Summary Heading: Rooms are not clean. Beds are old and terrible
Summary: The rooms are not clean and the beds are terrible.  I was charged a cancellation fee by the hotel even though I was there less than 3 hours.  I left because of the unsanitary condition of the rooms and the bed.  Please do not book this hotel you will not be happy.  The air handler in the room was full of dirt and black mold.  Steer clear there are better hotels in the area around the same price.

Summary Heading: if i coukd give zero stars i would
Summary: TERRIBLE. the beds were so uncomfortable and i found hairs underneath the covers..ew also found pills on the ground in my room. bed felt so gross i slept with my shoes on on top of the comforter. eveyone 30 mins the heater would turn on and it was so loud and shaky it would wake me up

The hotel says it was remodeled. It most definitely was, but it appears the hotel didn’t pay the bill in full and the contractors went back in and randomly chiseled things away. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The filters in the AC unit were horrendous. On top of that, we had ~5 sets of sheets in 3 days and 1 re-room. The last night we stayed we didn’t even have a fitted sheet because “the cleaning people left” sheets that were put on the bed were stained and the front desk person tried to tell me it was bleach. Check the photos for yourselves.
Room tip: Avoid this place, we got it using points and it wasn’t even worth that.

When I called to get our room to adjoin to our son and daughter-in-law's so we could help with the babies, we were told we'd have to upgrade to a suite as only suites are adjoining.  However, that's a complete lie as my mom and mother-in-law had  regular adjoining rooms 3 doors down from us on the 6th floor.  Secondly, they advertise a business center; however, when I went to print something off, I was told there was no business center.  Additionally, my sheets had huge stains on them.  My mother-in-law's carpet was all stained.  The beds and pillows were not comfortable. They only had refrigerators on the 8th floor even though all the rooms had a space for a

One of the Best in town. Excellent and superb location, you can come and go anywhere easy. Awesome rooms. Clean, bath, Coffee. Space. View. Comfort, parking. So really really enjoy everything. Luxury and nice to stay. Never wanna leave. So glad.

Summary Heading: Dont let the pictures fool you...dirty, gross and just plain awful.
Summary: Read before booking this hotel! This hotel puts a lot of work to look flashy on their website. The one room they actually put effort into is the lobby (which is their main picture) everything else is dirty and old and not maintained. Absolute worst hotel experience. They put us in a room with a King Bed but we had reserved a Queen so we had to move as soon as we got there. Bathroom hadn’t been cleaned well, there were pubic hairs on the toilet and the bathtub was pretty gross. You couldn’t order movies or even access a guide it’s like old school cable where you just flip through and try to guess what’s on. The maid service sometimes just didn’t come even though we didn’t have the door sign out. We had to move rooms again because the air was broken and unfixable. This was the

The water pressure and temperature gave me the ability to feel again, it hurt a lot but I wasn't able to feel anything before, so thank you. Even though the skin on my face and body are burned to a boil, I still would rather be in pain than the nothingness that was haunting me before. I would get hit by random objects and not even know it. No longer.
Room tip: I chose the cheapest option available to me. Worked out well.

Summary Heading: LOOKS & DESCRIPTION WILL ONLY FOOL YOU!!!
Summary: After an anxious want to stay here, I prob won't ever again... The rooms are just okay for the price they charge.. the bath tub was filthy! There's hardly any lighting in the bathroom which makes your shower damn near dark. There's major wear on the doors along with the floor divder was missing so it was born cement with a metal rod sticking out on the floor in between the bathroom & walkway.. the front desk guy was very odd, the younger girl was super sweet but older gal working with her was also very odd.. over all I wouldn't recommend staying here with all your choices of hotels around, as it's over priced for how filthy it was. Sorry hotel Huntington, but step up your game already! U have big time competitors around that win you over easy. You have potential so maybe if

On a macro level it looks modern and nice.  Upon closer inspection not so much.  Chipped paint and veneer on doors; carpet frayed around the edges; old brackets on the bathroom walls; bathroom fixtures a little rust; toilet wobbled a little (and it was the shortest toilet ever).  Furniture modern in style and in good shape but uncomfortable.  Breakfast buffet was underwhelming.  On the plus side water was hot, linens were clean, A/C was cold.  Parking complementary and convenient.    It may be a reasonable value but I did not make this reservation and cannot render a valid opinion since I have no knowledge of other hotels in the area.

I picked this hotel bc of how nice it looked online. When I got my room it looked like the place was falling apart. There was no light in the room I asked to be switched to a different room & they did not want to accommodate. The bathroom was disgusting the wood was chipped & lifting. In the picture it shows a pool with nice chairs LOL there was not one single nice chair to sit on. The hot tub was broken & it looked dirty over all. Housekeeping doesn’t respect the Do Not Disturb sign!! They went into my room even with the sign out I had to get new keys bc my old ones didn’t work since they had gone in. When I told front desk they didn’t even apologize on behalf of housekeeping. I deff won’t be coming back!

This hotel’s website says they have 224 newly renovated guest rooms. This is a flat out lie! The bathtub and toilets are disgusting! The furniture and doors show wear and tear. The mattress’s are old and you can feel the springs. They only provide 2 pillows. The fridge looked like it came out of an old dorm room. The painting looked like it was done by a kid. The only positive thing I could say about this hotel is that it was in a great location. This hotel isn’t even worth $50 a night let alone $150 a night.

We came for a trade show at Anaheim and there rooms were half price and very clean.   My son lost his gold chain in the bar at night and the next night the bartender saw him and handed it to him, thank you johnathon and Celeste!!!   Nobody does this, they did.  We had the most amazing Sunday brunch endless champagne with lots of crab, prime rib and incredible desserts.  5 star meal and service!  Check out the pictures, we travel every week and this hotel was a 10!

Location is great, bar was great, the surroundings were great. The rooms needed upgrades, and the first room we checked into had dirty linens. The front desk apologized and changed our room. The second room after the complaint smelled musty. Very disappointed. Did not use the pool or anything else because of the question of cleanliness. Was going to extend our stay there but after checking in decided to stay elsewhere.

Don’t know why we came here. Location is good. Breakfast is $17 a person. Worth $5. Everything is like trying to “get fixed” but In a cheap way. Our beds were awful. Full sized beds and the bedding didn’t even have fitted sheets to cover the mattresses. Hot tub was cold and tiny and smelled/looked so gross. I could go on and on about why the price is so cheap. Haha the hotel lobby ... don’t let it fool you. It’s the nicest part.

Summary Heading: Failed to follow through with request.
Summary: When we booked the hotel I confirmed that they had roll away beds (I have three 14 yr olds), so 5 ppl in the room (allowed). We asked for a double room with a roll away. They told us to call. I called the day before to confirm that a roll away bed was in the reservation. They said they would make a note and we needed to call back the day of our arrival. We called at 10am on the day of the arrival and confirmed, again, that we needed a roll away bed. They told us there was a fee (fine) and that there was one available and a note on our file. We asked if we could check in early as we were going to be gone all day. They said if we came at 11:45 we could not but if we came at 12:00 there would be no extra fee. We drove to the hotel at 12, and were told there was no room yet

They advertise that they are high end and charge high end prices, but the place is a dump! Wood was peeling off, the carpet looked as though it had never been cleaned, and there were multiple mystery dirty marks on the walls and ceilings. Not Okay at all!

Summary Heading: You can't dress up a pig.
Summary: From the outside, this hotel looks modern and nice.  It even has a good location.  Inside, the lobby floor is covered with buckets to catch the roof leaks (it was raining),  Our room was small, the wall heater was loud and functioned poorly.  The bathroom sink had no stopper and wouldn't drain.  The mattress was a medieval torture device.  It was so hard, neither my wife or I could sleep through the night.  We heard several other guests, while riding on the super-slow elevator, complaining about things not working in their rooms and being generally disgusted with this property.  Traveler beware!  I only gave it 2-stars because the sheets were clean and the location was handy to where I needed to be.  Otherwise......

When we first checked in our room a/c did not work, we were given another room which was on the opposite side of the building. The room was modern, clean and roomy. After a few days the bathroom sink would not empty. Maintenance sorted the problem quickly when I was out at work.   The management are not to be seen, the staff were polite and did what they could to make my stay pleasant . I must say Angie and Celeste (and lady from Venezuela) were wonderful and it was always nice having them suggest restaurants in the area and things to do. They always had a smile for the guests which was nice. If it wasn’t for staff like this , the hotel would loose a few points for broken items AC , washer and dryer , hot tub, .... the washer and dryer are very old and should have been replaced

We stayed here because it was the best price in the area.  The staff were very welcoming, the rooms were clean, the beds were comfy and the breakfast was great.  What more could you ask for a 2 night stay.

- All staff are so nice for welcome check in and fast check out - The location is just opposite with Cosco, Bella Mall, some restaurant (even two Vietnamese pho) - Easy to connect to Bolsa Ave and Little Saigon

I strongly advise not to stay at this hotel. The management lies and is not helpful at all. We were told our room had two queen beds when we specifically asked for a king bed. They told us they had no more rooms available with king beds which ended up to be a lie and clearly was because the hotel parking lot only had about three cars in it. The way we found out the supervisor had been lying about the king beds was because we went back about ten minutes later and a different employee told us he could get us a room with a king size bed. Which we appreciated. The beds aren’t any good if you are wanting to sleep the whole night. The mattresses feel like sleeping on a piece of wood and are about 40 yrs old. The pillows are great if you like waking up in the morning with a broken

Very nice hotel! Bed was extremely comfy, really nice large room and accommodations.  Located next to a nice shopping area with lots of restaurants.  Very short drive down beach blvd to the pier.   Only downsides: Hot water was more like lukewarm and there was no fridge in room.  Otherwise an amazing hotel.  Would definitely stay here again!

When you first walk into the  Hotel Huntington Beach it’s very nice looking and you expect it to be a very posh place.  Unfortunately that’s where the charm ends.   I’d first like to say, the staff were excellent. Unfortunately that’s the best thing I can say about the place.  When we got to our room the mattress was disgustingly filthy.  The bed.  Not only had a very old mattress but it was filthy The amenities of the room we’re very few.  They had a very cheap coffee maker, no microwave, no refrigeration.  We stayed for 2 nights and needed to keep drinks and snacks cold. They told us they would put us on Oh waiting list for the refrigerator. Unfortunately we never got one. The bathroom had very poor lighting and had a toilet that did not want to flush.   The breakfast was an

I don’t even know where to start other than to say I will never be staying here again, nor would I recommend anyone else to stay here.  In fact, if it wasn’t for a colleague needing to stay at this hotel I would have left and gone to stay elsewhere after the first night.  I had issues on the arrival first day with the hotel not recording correct charge back to my business account from the booking information. I dealt with this at the time (or so I thought) and notations appeared to have been made by staff acknowledging that fact.  I thought this could have been down to an error by my service provider so was kind of like “our bad” (although I do note that I had no issues with other accomodations I stayed at on this trip so now do believe it was the hotels issue).  After receiving

Rooms were dirty, hair on the outside of the tub, hallways look like they weren't ever vacuumed, housekeeping didn't clean our room one day.  Elevator takes forever and one of the doors doesn't open for an adequate amount of time.  No fridge or microwave, we were told by staff that "if one becomes available you can use it".  The rooms (I saw 3) in general are very outdated  - not as advertised online. Linens were very worn, the pillows were awful and they just gave you one.  The window treatments were minimal so you couldn't block out the light at all.  IMPOSSIBLE to get a hold of management staff.  Maintenance staff were unfriendly and rude.  This place is a total dump that's poorly managed.

This hotel looks great online but is not what it seems. When you get there the lobby looks new and is designed well. It went bad when the elevators would take forever and they were just super slow. We finally got to our room to find that it wasn’t even very clean, the shower didn’t work very well, and the room was very outdated. There wasn’t a refrigerator or a microwave in the rooms like pretty much every other hotel. The bed also was not very comfortable and the blinds sucked as well. I would not recommend anyone to stay there.

Summary Heading: Definitely staying here again.  Great value for the hotel in the costa mesa/huntington beach area
Summary: I've stayed in numerous hotels around the Costa Mesa area that are about the same price point as this hotel.  This by far the best value and most comfortable hotel.  Compared to other hotels in the same price points this one is a lot cleaner too.   I'm really not sure why there are so many bad reviews of this place.   It's true that this place did use slightly cheaper materials for their remodel, but a lot of other hotels in this price point do a half remodel where they only paint the wall and not the ceiling.  I've also seen two other hotels in the newport beach area with higher ratings where there were huge holes in the bathroom ceilings.  Pros: 1) nicely remodeled 2) comfortable beds 3) extremely clean 4) right off the freeway 5) in walking distance to a movie theater, nice

Smoke and Mirrors as you look at these photos and you think you're walking into luxury.  Not the case, the owners have tried to portray the place and new and improved.  Sorry a cheap coat of paint can't mask the outdated and old furniture and accomodations.  I have traveled all over the world, the first hotel in my life asked me to pay $50 because I wanted to check in before 1pm and my room was ready.  The gym is a closet with 2 cheap treadmills and one weight machine.  Do NOT stay here.

Summary Heading: Bad management not worth to stay in here!

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and I will never stay here again. This was my first visit to California and I'm very disappointed this was my first

Based on the photos and the appearance of the exterior of the building you would assume this is a decent hotel. Don't be fooled... . During my stay three major facilities were out of service: pool, gym and laundry. The wifi barely worked, signal not solid enough for a skype or facetime call. The lifts are unreliable and slow (small one but annoying when you have deal with them several times a day).  Rooms need a bit of TLC, lots of chipped paint, dripping taps etc. There was no fridge in my room - just a hole in the cabinet as a reminder of where you would expect to find one.   Breakfast is a rip-off at $15USD and barely edible. Just a sad selection of artificial looking eggs, sausage and bacon. Cereal choices limited to fruit loops and cornflakes. Summary Heading: Good if you are on a tight budget....
Summary: If you are on a tight budget, then this hotel is acceptable; however, I will not be staying at this hotel again.  The hotel room was not well maintained. Carpet had huge stains from water that might have been from overflow in the bathroom. I didn’t want to be in the room barefoot, thankfully they do provide cheap little house slippers.  Door knobs barely worked.  The shower head didn’t look like it had been cleaned in a long time, there was brown stuff around all of the little holes. Due to this and the overall cleanliness of the room, I did not shower. I was also afraid the tub wasn’t clean and didn’t have flip flops to shower in. I used the sink for a sponge bath and called it good for that night.  Hope this helps.

Room ok Price resonable Internet connection very poor and bad In-house telephone out of order Room services is not 24h Nearby many shopping center Far from LAX airport by near to Disneyland And near to little saigon Breakfast 20 USD

I attended a fashion show at the hotel. I purchased a drink from their bar, my tab was $11.01...I was charged $1,746. I informed management and all they had to say was I'm sorry and that they had voided the transaction. I was left with a pending charge all weekend and charges did not drop for 3 business days! Management did not offer to make me happy in any way. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

We stayed here for New Years Eve. We chose the location because it was walking distance to several restaurants and a movie theatre. Our room was a suite and we couldn’t have been happier. Staff was friendly and check in was efficient. Make sure you check out Old World Village across the street. They have a nice German restaurant and bar.

She said many people complained and she would try to get us a discount. People check into a hotel to sleep. Lots of drinking. Called back next day. New Desk supervisor said she knew nothing, about it, but would check with her boss. Wife called next day and spoke with the supervisor. He claimed total ignorance and asked for total details in an email to be sent. At my wife's insistence I wrote the email, but was pretty sure we were being scammed. Summary Heading: Adequate room. No frills. Convenient location.
Summary: Pros: Location right off the Fwy, next to Old World where we were attending a wedding was the reason we booked here. Suite was large. King bed was average comfort. Free parking Water supplied at check in if requested Free Wi-Fi, but...it was quite slow  Cons: Low sofa area was not very comfortable Lighting was poor (very dark) Noisy with freeway nearby 2 of 3 elevators did not work! Very slow to get up and down. Rate was a little high for a very average location The 'suite' is just a large room - not a bedroom with a separate door.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Price Right for Short Visit
Summary: We were in town only for a few days for a family emergency.  As our last-minute cross-country flights were expensive, we were looking for an inexpensive hotel.  The price was right.  Free onsite parking was great.  Wifi worked fine. Lobby is nice, front desk staff were outstanding on all shifts we interacted with them, which was around the clock most days.  3 elevators only which 1 seemed to be working, making it slow.  The room was clean, had 2 beds, which were entirely too small, and about 6 inches off the floor.  Not enough lighting, no frig or microwave.  Toilet barely flushed and when it did ran constantly. No stopper in the sink  Mini muffins, coffee and fruits in the lobby in the mornings.  Across the street from Bella Terra, where we walked to have dinner one night.

Summary Heading: Good location, not bad value for money
Summary: Rooms and halls are a bit on the dark side.  The infrastructure is looking a bit tired.  Breakfast is not a great selection (very little fruits, vegetables or healthy fare), but the breakfast team deserves rave reviews.  There is not a scrap of parkland nearby, if one has the urge to jog.  But it’s sure close to the expressway.

Do not be deceived by online photos as this hotel is a poorly renovated overpriced location. The staff wasn't aware the gym was out of service, the room blinds were dysfunctional, paint was peeling off the walls, the low grade AC units are very outdated, the shower levers were loose and old, coffee maker didn't fit the cartridges provided and the pool was poorly maintained. It should not be over $119 a night, more like $75. Worse $135 dollars spent in one day!

This property says it's location is Huntington Beach but it's about as far away from the beach as possible.  It's a high rise with paper thin walls, no fridge or small microwave, one working elevator out of three available elevators and questionable ice machines on even numbered floors.  The toilet was old and just functional.  The good side was the check in staff was great, parking was adequate and free,  and the Wi-Fi was functional. The amenities were good.   I didn't use the restaurant or bar or any other facilities.  The room was clean and the bed was good.  The rate was good for Southern California.

The area that the hotel is in is very accessible to restaurants as there is a mall right across the street. This is a good thing because the "restaurant" that was listed was just a lounge that I did not want to bring my daughter into. Only one of the two elevators worked and I thought every time that we got in it that it would get stuck. The rooms look nice until you look closer and see the chipping paint, the knicks in the doors, and realize that the sink does not drain. The doors actually looked like they had been purchased from other hotels that were done using them. The service of the staff though was exemplary. They were very sweet at the front desk, even remembering which day was my daughter's birthday and wishing her a happy birthday as we left for Disneyland in the

Summary Heading: Zero would be better score but...
Summary: I had stayed at this hotel many years ago and it was nice. I thought I would bring my husband with me this time on our anniversary and seeing the family. Well, out of 3 elevators, only 1 worked. There was no manager all wknd until Sunday when we checked out to complain. Our first room had an ac unit that sounded like a hamster wheel going all night. The soap holder in shower was loose and spins around. The water in shower didn't shut off and drips. And maybe this has always been this way but our sheets were only covering the sides of the bed not a fitted sheet and under the sheet was a sorry looking thin cotton protector and the comforter was awful. We changed rooms the next day. The beds in both rooms were like sleeping on wooden board with thin padding. We had horrible back

Summary Heading: Not Excellent But Definitely Not Bad
Summary: I read several reviews prior to staying here and was a bit hesitant. Overall on a scale of 1 to 10 I would rate it a 7.5. The outside of the hotel, the lobby and the ground level public areas were quite nice. The guest floor hallways and guest room are hopefully next for an upgrade. They were not horrible but you can tell they have had a lot of use. LOL The room was okay style wise. Was clean and comfortable. Slept like a baby in the king size bed and the a/c kept the room nice and cold, just how I like it. The shelving in the restroom and the chair and ottoman had some miles on them for sure. And yes, like most people complain about, there was no wifi available. But isn't that why we have smart phones? LOL  The Sunday Champagne Brunch was delicious. So many choices and

The elevator was like a Disneyland ride - fast. The pool was dirty. The management was only interested in the fact that there was to be no parties of any kind. The room was a mix of furniture. NO safe or refrigerator.  The bed was bigger than the box springs.  If you sant on the edge of the bed, the top flipped up. I wouldn't let my dog stay here.

My family stayed here in July 2017. On the plus side, they had decent pancakes, the front desk staff was polite, and the lobby was nice.   The lobby is a disguise!!!!!!!  None of the amenities are functional, the indoor pool has green tint and stains on the bottom, the fitness center is more of a storage unit for broken equipment, only one floor had a working ice machine, the dryer was hit and miss. Only one of the three elevators is working and there is a sign stating push the up button to go down. The elevator door closes abruptly and slammed shut on my teenage sons arm, then later on my daughters. It drops like the Tower of Terror ride. There was wall paper peeling off the window areas in the common hallways, and the air conditioner units were unplugged. The ceiling in the

1 uncomfortable pillow per person, no actual cover on our stained duvets. NO wifi in the rooms which is quite vital to me, as someone who is abroad and has no phone service (despite stating wifi available), neither lift works properly (no available stairs) and even vending machine on our floor doesn't work. No full length mirror in room, and shower controls really loose and ineffective. Other than that, air con is good, TVs are good, and they leave nice small breakfast snack foods downstairs in the lobby.

Came in on business, no internet service they are looking for another carrier, bathroom stool old Anand yellow stained, gym equipment broken Anand hall ways filthy. Will never com back. No water in the gym place is run done. Not worth booking

Unfortunately, this hotel needs a REAL makeover! It appears that it has had somewhat of a face lift however, lacking. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating however, the rooms and the hotel over are old, dank and need a lot of TLC.

This hotel is very clean and nice. The pool was heated. Breakfast was good. Great views from our room. The lady that checked us in was amazing as well, she sent us to a room that wasnt ready for a new guest so we came down stairs and informed her and she appologized and gave my girlfriend and i free breakfast coupons for the inconvinience, she had amazing customer service skills, i cant remember her name maybe is was "cc" because thats what she wrote on the breakfast coupon. A+ to her for her generosity!!

The staff were A+. The facility is under remodel and still needs much work. Pool made my swim suit smell horrible after it dried. They did offer a nice discount to military and  government employees. 2nd time I have stayed here. Not as close to Huntington Beach as I thought. Mainly due to horrible traffic in the area. The hotel is directly across from Costco.

I stayed here 3 times total in the last few years , but the last time was terrible, under construction, removed fridge, old tub and sink, smelly mattress, noisy , big gap under main door so you can here people walking by.  By the way, no breakfast....yet

I stay here on business given its close proximity to the company I work for, but continue to experience significant issues with the condition of the room (peeling paint and wallpaper, moldy caulk on sink and bathtub, poor wifi, elevators not working).   When I checked in my last visit, the friendly front desk staff welcomed me back and assured me they were giving me their "best" room given my past experiences. Well if this was their best, more than likely these women have never seen their rooms. Upon checkout I asked to speak with the Mgr. or General Mgr. and again told they weren't available. I left my cell and email address and two weeks later no contact.   This was my last stay at this property as they seemingly don't understand we as customers have choices, the necessity of

This was a good stay, with a few minor quirks.  The room was clean and comfortable. The walls had some  paint chipping off but was fresh and pleasant. Housekeeping was incredibly quick and the front desk staff are very polite.  It's a good hotel at a fair price.  I will book again.

Summary Heading: Very average although the location is great
Summary: Just another hotel. My room had horrible wifi after the first night (had to use the hotspot on my phone several times). There was no water pressure in the shower. The maids forgot at least one thing each day. On the flip side, the location is great being directly across the street from many amenities. The front desk were super nice also.

Summary Heading: I stay here one a week - nothing wrong with this hotel
Summary: Good value for the $, and it is a decent clean hotel. Good for business, and close to local stores.  No reason to spend more at lesser facilities.  I've been in the OC once a week for the past three years.  This is where I've landed.

Bums all around the hotel in the evening and people fighting and screaming in the hallway at 2am. No help from staff. Breakfast tasted like cold cardboard.You'll get no rest here. It's about as peaceful as a dumpster fire. Stay elsewhere.

Beds were uncomfortable, no fridge, one elevator, overall poor experience.  Won't stay again. Lighting in the bathroom was horrible, water was warm couldn't get it hot.  Hot tub was cold.  Housekeeping was rude and not helpful.

I stayed here the week of Feb 19th thru 24th 2017 on business. I was very disappointed in several things.   Restaurant is hardly ever open. Wanted to have dinner at 6:30pm on Sunday and it wasn't open.  Workout facility equipment is terrible. 90% of the equipment didn't work or was broken.  Internet connection was basically non-existent..I had to use my phone as a hot spot to get anything done.  Vending machine on floor was broken.  maid service was terrible  out of three elevators only one worked.  I have never stayed in a hotel that didn't have a dresser...Now i have.  Skeleton staff on duty although the staff that was there was fine.  I travel on business often and have NEVER stayed at a place as disappointing as this place.

Stay away from this hotel! Cockroaches in both rooms we had along with mold in the bathrooms! In addition, they have three elevators and only one works. Hot tub has paint peeling and looks dirty. Filed a health report with the Orange County health department.

This review is a little different than most, as I never had the chance to stay here. I've been dealing with the Sales Manager Chris, but have not received any responses back from him since 12/11/16. I've also tried contacting the hotel as well, but have not received a response from them either. I've already made my reservation for the end of March, but since I cannot get any requested information back from the Hotel, I will have to cancel. Upon reading the other reviews on this Hotel, I'm thinking that cancelling is probably a good decision!

So gross - do not stay here. The room clearly had water damage and the ceiling had been quickly plastered over but the hallway into our room was just left as is with pieces hanging down. The carpet and bedding were old and dingy. The bathroom had no towel rack - just two towels sitting on the counter. The pool and spa were to dirty to venture into and the lack of lighting made the area even less appealing. Overall this hotel simply made me itchy and gaggy.

Summary Heading: Judge this hotel by the recent reviews
Summary: Stayed here for an event my company hosted next door at the German restaurant. Bad decision on my part for not looking at the reviews prior to booking as I normally do. As soon as I walked in I smelled the mildew coming from the lobby and once you got onto your floor you could smell the same thing in the hallways and rooms. I said rooms because I was moved from one to another since the room I booked was non-smoking I smelled smoke in it. Both room had no refrigerator to store any drinks or left over food for later use. When asked if the other rooms had the same set-up I was told no some have them some don't, mind you this is the very first hotel I've ever been to and not had a refrigerator in it I mean heck if the travel lodges can afford one I think your hotel needs to as well.

Booked an Executive King Suite and had to move due to no wifi reception (talked to Tech Dept. and was told they have been recommending the hotel upgrade their routers for months). Second room had condition issues from moldy caulking around bathroom sink, to a blind that didn't fully close leaving a 6" gap at the bottom, to dust covered wall adjacent to the window AC unit. I was a given a modest 20% adjustment at checkout and still waiting for the hotel Mgr. to follow up.

Couple of my best friends and I made plans to spend some time together at a good quality place for brunch on Sunday.  And my friend picked Hotel Huntington!  What a big mistake. We liked the champagne but that's all. Nothing else to good.  $140 for 3 of us and what a waste of our money.  Lobster tails and shrimp were so watery and mushy.  Honey Walnut Shrimp was just ok...its way better at other places.  White fish with mango sauce was terrible because the fish was so old and you can taste the "old" taste.  There were other stuff there but just did not look appealing.   Even the orange juice was not fresh!

Roaches, mildew , noisy college kids  DO NOT STAY HERE! I ignored the reviews and regretted it.  Don't trust the pictures they have up on their sight this place is nasty ! It's not a nice modern hotel, you smell the mildew as soon as you walk in. I was in a renovated room and it was gross. I cannot even imagine what a room that hadn't been renovated is like.

This hotel is great for people on business and needing a cheap hotel, not for a traveller...or someone from abroad, it's really far from the beach, $15 Uber.  Guess I got confused with the name and the location which was a mistake, but not to worry. There's nothing to do around the area really apart from a shopping centre and the highway.  The room seemed clean and tidy, modern in areas with room for improvement elsewhere such as old wood breaking off from the part that joins carpet and tiles, the bathroom was ok, needed modernisation I would say. Not really budget for money either. What I believed was £178 for two nights came to £220, you have to be aware that tax is added on after. I paid for the room in advance but clearly the hotel had other ideas, they didn't charge for

We recently stayed at the Hotel Huntington Beach for 4 nights.   I booked the hotel through hotwire.com.  I selected the hotel based on star ratings, location and self parking.   From the outside, this hotel is nice and new looking.  However, once you are inside, the hotel is old and dated.   There are three elavators inside the hotel but only one that was operating.  Our room was nice and clean but it was old and dated.  The sheets were ratty with holes.   The sheets were not white but a worn faded white color from wash after wash for many years.   The bath towels were in same condition; old and ratty.   The hand towels had stains on them.   We had to move to a different room on our last night because the bathroom tub  was clogged and there was brown water that came up.   It

After a long exhausting flight get to our hotel to find a not so spotless room.  Fitness center (if you want to call it that) SUCKED! There was one treadmill and one elliptical machine which were probably from the 80's. Not only that it didn't open till 6am!  The pool area looked awful as well.  On the plus side breakfast was good.

Service was a nice 4/5 but the quality of the room just felt dirty. Bathroom door would not lock, Paint missing on walls, Water damage along with stains on the carpet. It was comfortable but i feel there is an extreme lack of effort especially when my door does not lock. Elevators are low quality as well. It felt like a fright elevator. Price was OK. You get what you pay for.

This is a big hotel and beautiful from the outside, inside it's got that cheap feeling, walls are paper thin, young people everywhere because the college is right down the street.  I checked out very early so didn't hear much but there's a lot of activity.  They could have made this place great with just some extras, when a hotel doesn't paint often inside you can tell.  The location is fantastic if you want to shop, have dinner or just grab coffee.  Terra Bella is right across the street next to Costco and lots of great shops.

I had a fairly late decision to go to my high school reunion in Huntington Beach. Huntington Beach in summer is not easy to get a room with only a month's notice but this hotel popped up on Trip Advisor. I had my small dog with me and they were very nice about it. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. The maid was always quick to clean the room. There were lots of kids and it got pretty noisy at times with kids running and yelling down the hall. The room also seemed very dark in an attempt at a modern urban decor. I found it difficult to read and the lighting in the bathroom was poor for make up application. Dining at the hotel was also limited. The staff were very friendly and it was conveniently located. It's next to a mall so lots of restaurants there.

I had the opportunity to stay at this estsblishment as I traveled in Southern California. The exterior of the facility is.modern. It is across from Costco and other businesses. The lobby looks fantastic with an area to use your laptop/notebook. It has a restaurant and bar. The hotel reps checked me in immediately and out as well the following morning. HH does not offer a complementary breakfast, but also doesn't charge for overnight parking. The room was similar to a Hampton Inn. The walls in the hallway could use some sprucing up as well as the interior of the rooms. The bed was comfortable. The room felt clean. I was satisfied with my stay compared to the previous night where I stayed at a dump.

Stayed one night for wedding reception at Old World across the street. It was nice for convenience. The shower water was scalding hot. And a bunch of kid we're going up and down in the elevators causing them to brake it. We had to climb 5 flights of stairs to get to are room. No apologies from any of the staff.

My friends and I just recently stayed at this property for a Caribbean Music Festival called BRT. We were very impressed with the hotel including the hotel staff. Every request made was answered in a timely manner (Given the fact that there was 4 of us in the room we constantly called housekeeping for extra towels, shampoo, etc.)    I would highly recommend staying here if you are in the Huntington Beach area :)

Summary Heading: Good hotel, good price, good location
Summary: Good room:  the fifth floor  far down the hallway away from the elevator, with a good view of the shopping center across the street. Good service: requested extra towels at 9:30 PM and they were brought up in less than 10 min Front desk: fast, efficient, polite service Room amenities: shampoo, slippers, coffee, comfortable king bed, some wear-and-tear but barely noticeable Breakfast buffet:  excellent meal for the price ($12 per) Pool: adequate space, not crowded Shopping: mall across the street that you can easily walk to. Nice Japanese restaurant (try the Brussels sprouts,) movie theater, other eateries. Parking: plenty on-site parking Overall: good hotel in a modern, safe location.  Definitely would stay here again.

I stayed one night. We got this room for the indoor pool and jacuzzi. The jacuzzi was cold, and the indoor pool was filthy. Staff was extremely unprofessional when we complained and didn't provide any explanation or an apology. I would not stay here at all. As far as the room goes: it's nice, smelled really bad like dirty socks, I had to keep the door open and use a diffuser to rid the smell as much as I could. Way too overpriced and you get nothing for your money. Stay elsewhere.

A two night stay was just lovely at this hotel. Beds were very comfortable. The chic neon lights and totally custom lights in the Lobby made me think we were in Europe. Great location for walking to stores and a fine bakery. Staff was courteous and cordial. I would definitely return.

Help was great, but you would like a room that is not shabby and rundown.  Even has an old TV along with partial fixtures in the bathroom.  They showed my wife a remodeled room weeks before we came.  Definitely bait and switch...

I personally didn't like this hotel much at all and neither did my girlfriend. I thought it was very pretentious and wayyyyy too modern looking for me. The lobby was kind of nice, but the room was just uncomfortable. The furniture looked like it was from the future and wasn't even comfortable to lay or sit in. Guest services sucked, can't really blame them though. Both the ladies were oriental and could hardly speak any English. Overall, this is definitely on my "don't stay here again" list.

Summary Heading: Good on the outside, bad on the inside!
Summary: The hotel's overall apperance when you first enter through the lobby is good, but when we went up to our room we weren't very happy. It was dirty, dingy and kind of falling apart. The floors are gross and worn out, the shower is smelly and moldy, the beds are also kind of gross. The bathroom is extremely outdated, along with the linens/towels. The Landry room was unspeakably unkept, don't use it.  We had to request a fridge, they brought it up in minutes. The good part is that the location is hard to beat, as it is close to many shopping plazas, major roadways and beachs. The hotel does not have free wifi service which maybe a problem for some. If you are staying in the area, choose a different hotel if possible :)

When I parked in the parking lot, there was trash and beer bottles scattered through out the parking spaces. Then you walk into a fairly nice upscale lobby and it appears to be very nice. Check in was smooth and no issues.  The room was in need of some upgrades and attention. The door had no security lock, the room smelt very musty and dank, the shower had a dripping faucet and corrosion all over and it smelt bad. You can see on the walls where they were patched and painted over. If you didn't pay any attention to detail you wouldn't notice but you could tell things were done very cheaply here.   Great location but I would not be returning here.

Summary Heading: Improvements will add to the experience
Summary: The great: 1. location: under a minute to highway I405, across the street to Berra Terra shopping center 2. Free parking  The good: 1. Room size is good 2. Water pressure and temperature are good, even at top floor 3. Ice machine on every floor 4. Newer interior 5. There is an iron board  The bad: 1. Lobby staff is unevenly cordial, guests returning and leaving the lobby often not greeted, feel like walking through an empty lobby 2. Housekeeping is very lack of attention to details.  The only things you noticed the room was serviced are the bed and the refilling of bathroom essentials. The ice bucket was never cleaned, the old coffee cups with leftover coffee, the glasses with leftover water, the clothes were in exactly arrangement as when you left the room in the morning 3.

Sheets were dirty and grey off white. The fire alarm went off 6 or so times. The lobby floor had towels on it from leaks or something. Faucets had corrosion. Terrible customer service. Watched an older woman get a full discount for the entire night while I paid full price. Maybe it was my tattoos and jeans? Felt discriminated against perhaps because I am not Caucasian? Regardless, I was treated terribly by the staff.

The hotel is in a great location, but the rooms are dated and smelled a little musty.  We killed 2 roaches during our stay, and the "free breakfast" offered consisted of coffee, fruit, and packaged mini-muffins.  Another breakfast, costing $12/person, is available as well, but was a catered-type affair with chaffing dishes of food.   The bed was comfortable, the room was relatively clean.  The staff were helpful, but the fire alarm sounded for both nights we were there several times--starting at 2AM and continuiting roughly every 90 minutes until the morning.  The staff gave a discount, but our stay was pretty much ruined as we couldn't get any sleep.

The hotel is located in a great location in Huntington Beach. Across the street is a shopping mall with access to great restaurants.  The windows in the room provided great natural light during the day, but the room is dark with only 1 lamp on the nightstand with a 60W bulb for lighting at night. We literally needed our cell phone flashlights  at night to find things on the floor. There is another light by the bathroom with no full length mirror. The lighting in the bathroom is also poor. The bed was comfortable but the towels for bathing were thin.  I found a roach in our room and in the hallway of the hotel.

I was expecting this hotel to be phenomenal after finding out a room for one night would cost $129, but unfortunately it was nowhere near worth it. The room itself was utterly small and cramped with barely any room to walk around. This hotel only had the two beds, a small tv, a shower and sink, but nothing else. There was no refrigerator, no windows to open up, no microwave. The glasses that were in the room were still dirty with smudges of old drinks left on them. It was very unpleasant.  When booking I asked for a hotel with two beds, but for some unknown reason the hotel originally gave me a room with one king bed. Since I had 4 guests in one room, this obviously wouldn't work. So I told the person at the front desk that I would need a 2 bed room and she was a great help, she

The location is perfect for just about everything.  It is a well staged hotel. The decor is modern but the rooms leave much to desire. The air conditioners are from the old and loud. The bathroom counters are warped. The bathroom leaks water for a long time after you use the shower.

Stayed this hotel Weds-Saturday night.  ONLY Wednesday was a good night sleep.  Thursday night was vacuum sweep night at Costco parking lot across street from hotel....this went on til 11:30PM  Friday night starting at 8PM there is a dance club just around the corner from the hotel which played loud music and I could clearly hear every word the DJ would say.   Must have heard  'time to: get this party started!' 15 times......UNTIL 1:30AM!   Then the rude and noisy patrons walked back to this hotel making noise and laughing until 2AM.   Woke up Sat. feeling worn out.  Saturday....basically a repeat of Friday night......same noise, same club noise and noisy people...UNTIL 2 AM  A G A I N!   Woke up Sunday AM.....feeling no sleep.  The internet in room room worked  WHEN IT WANTED

Summary Heading: Cheap and stinky. Very bad service!!
Summary: I went one night last week. I paid 130 dollars for a weekday (Wednesday) There was only a receptionist with about 30 people to check in. I did not see his smile at all. He was not welcoming us at all. When we asked for a refrigerator as I need to put a medication on it, he said we don't have. After I insisted he said he could get one. He sent us to w˙at he called a nice room. It was terrible, as soon as we got in, the smell was just nauseating, and the room did not look to be cleaned. Toilet paper was the cheapest I see in a hotel. Mattress seems to be old or with a lot of use, it was not comfortable. the head of the bed (made with fabric) did not look clean neither. The worst hotel I ever been in. Not recommended at all!!They are liars, they sale the rooms with breakfast and

Aggressive and unprofessional when they make mistakes. When I asked the very defensive manager to stop interrupting me he replied . . . wait for it . . . from a supposed hospitality expert: "Well, you're repeating yourself." "Calm down," he went on. So bad it's funny. I won't be back.

Hotels usually authorize your credit card for fifty bucks or so, in case you buy something...well Hotel Huntington charges your card for a whopping $150 !! There is no mini bar, the room is just average....so what are we buying here for $150? iF you have a debit card, they will actually debit your bank card, and that money will be unavailable for 5 days or more! I dont recommend this place at all. ots just an average hotel, with nothing sepcial. Even a 5 star luxury hitel doesnt gouge you for that mouch money deposit. The people at the front desk dont smile, or even look like theyre remotely interested in helping you. The night I got there two desk people were on the phone for   almost fifteen minutes. Probably talking to angry cystomers calling to ask when they are getting

The Hotel is nothing special. The lobby area is attractive, but the hallway on the 4th floor did not have air conditioning and was not maintained very well. The room, on the other hand, was quite nice and the air conditioner worked very well and the King bed was comfortable. The location was very good across from the Bella Terra Mall. Would I return? Probably not. I would pay a little more and stay at the BW property on Beach Blvd.

I stayed at this property on business for one night.  After reading several reviews, I was skeptical to see where my company chose to put me up for the night.  Please bear in mind, the Orange County area was experiencing an unprecedented heat wave during my stay.  As mentioned by other reviewers, the lobby was very nice and modern, albeit very warm.  There were two employees, both were anxious to check me in.  I checked in with no problem and was given a parking permit for my vehicle. The hallway to the room was warm, muggy, and generally uncomfortable but of course I had no plans on sleeping in the hallway!  The room was very nice.  It was decorated nice and the bed was comfortable.  The sitting chair, although modern, left a good deal to be desired.  I used the desk chair.

+ Convenient location: Many eateries, shops, cinema, costco just across the road + Enough parking space -Breakfast!!Don't know whether I should call it breakfast or whether it was just a courtesy coffee, as with other hotels, I was expecting the breakfast in pantry or some area where one can sit and eat something, however, in this case, near the reception, only coffee and muffins were kept, if the management considers it as just courtesy coffee then its ok, otherwise, it is not passable as breakfast.

Hotel owner is either circling the drain and out of money, or is milking the property for every last penny and not spending anything on upkeep and maintenance.  Outside building appearance and lobby are deceiving; both look neat and tidy.  When you step off the elevator into the hallway expect an “oh my God” moment.  It appears this place attracts a sketchy customer base which has resulted in the building looking like it has had a very hard life.  Room pics posted speak for themselves; you can extrapolate these images to the rest of the hotel.

I liked this hotel because is clean, good service, and good price. Good location and you have shops across the street easy access to the fwy.  About 10 min from the beach. In overall it's a good decent place to stay! Very happy I would recommend it..

Summary Heading: Nice stay, convenient location, a bit expensive!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.  It was central to Westminster and Huntington Beach area. Room was decent, friendly service and staff.  We arrived late but had no trouble checking in.  In addition, they did not charge for parking as quoted, which was a plus!  We would come back again if coming to the area.

I was a little put off by so many of the bad reviews I read here on Trip Advisor, but I went ahead and made reservations because the location was close to where we needed to be and the price our budget. I am so glad we stayed here. In fact I was amazed that the hotel did not have a higher star rating. The staff was excellent, I can not say enough good things about them. We arrived around 11:30AM on Friday morning and asked if we could check in early because we had been up since 3:30AM and had a full night ahead of us. They said our room was almost ready. So we walked across to the Terra Bella Shopping area and found several excellent restaurants to choose from for our lunch. Then we walked back over to the hotel and checked in, took a nap, and headed out to see friends till

The hotel is convenient located. Just opposite of the Hotel, you can find good restaurant, coffe shop, some stores. Our room was confortable, and the breakfast OK. By the way, the brunch on Sunday is delicious. Is a little be far from the beach.

I thought the hotel was a great deal and the price was really good, but after actually staying there I figured out why the price was so good. I have never written a review, but I feel the need to warn people about this place.  1. The front desk is unfriendly and not helpful. We asked for rooms together and we checked in right when check-in started (on a Wednesday) and they said it's almost impossible because we are completely booked. I thought to myself, has everyone checked in? The parking lot was empty so it puzzled me that they weren't able to get 2 rooms together.  2. They have no stairs going up. We had to wait for almost half an hour to get on the elevator because there were so many people in the lobby at 9pm.   3. The AC in the room was broke so it was either freezing or

Stayed here to go to the angel's game and beach.  The only gripes I had were they didn't change our sheets on the 3rd night and the bed was on the older side.  Other than that, good value and location.  Would stay again.

Honestly, if I could give a Zero star rating, I would. My family got a block of rooms at this hotel. From the time I made the reservation, I have been told 4 different prices on my reservation (3 rooms) ranging from around $400 to over $800 after my repeated  confirmations. Paying for the rooms wasn't an issue, but their customer service is severely lacking. I have 13+ years in Customer Service. 5+ Years Service Industry/Hospitality. I have never been so disrespected in my life. upon check-in, I meet Oscar. Oscar does not greet me. He simply asks if im checking in, which we said we were, he asked for my name. I gave him my name and I'm assuming that the reservation at this point was STILL wrong, because he just said "2 rooms". I immediately said no, I have 3. he says nothing and

Arrived at the hotel and was very impressed by the hip and modern looking lobby. Figured we would have a pretty sweet room if the lobby looked like that. Stood at the check-in desk for a good while behind some drunk lady trying to find a bar until one of the gals realized I wasn't with her and offered to check me in. Process was quick and when I asked if the $12 breakfast buffet was any good and served a variety of foods, I got a "nahhh, it's not very impressive." I thought well thanks for being honest anyway! When we walked into the room we were very disappointed to find it looked like it was in a different era than the lobby. Lots of chipped paint and dismal looking beds and decor. The shower head was very low and the toilet seat unusually high! Although clean, this place was

I was here for two nights, each night there was a function in the hotel, the noise from the Rogue Lounge echoed into the main lobby and onto the room floor I was on till the wee hours. (I had to blast the Ac to drown out the noise). That's fine if you're here to party, I wasn't. I couldn't find parking the second night as there was another function going on, maybe the locals hang out here, IDK. I was told breakfast was included in the price then asked to pay $12.95 for breakfast, which was the normal sausage & scrambled eggs. I opted for the corner bakery just a small walk in a lovely strip mall area with beautiful waterfalls. Starbucks was close by. I did like the Contemporary furnishings in the room but the bathroom was dated. The hotel was about 5 miles from the Pier, If I

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel... good value... Don't use the Restaurant
Summary: Having read some of the past reviews I thought I was in big trouble booking this place.  But, was I surprised. First off, I didn't run into any problems with the facility or staff or accommodations ... everything was just right.  No elevator problems, no staff issues, the rooms were clean and appropriately furnished and the HVAC system worked to make the room comfortable climate-wise.  The location is perfect.  Near the Bella Terra shopping center with lots of eating places and only about 7 miles from the beach.  Oh, and parking is free and there's free Wi-Fi.  There are free mini-muffins and coffee in the lobby every morning.  Great value.  After the second night I decided to try the breakfast buffet for $12.  I have traveled all over the world and seen the most elaborate

I needed to travel to Huntington Beach for Business, I typically stay with the major hotels; however I was asked to hold my expenses down so I read the reviews.  Based on all the reviews I decided to stay, after all I could park my car and walk to the office.    Positives is that this hotel is close to shopping and nice restaurants.  Negative it is very outdated, make sure you do not get the 8th floor as this floor has not been remodeled proof is in the pictures.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, especially for the price
Summary: Great place, super clean, great staff! Would stay there again... Actually we went back  But 2nd time we stayed we got a room with a huge sliding bathroom door. Very heavy but didn't cover the whole door!! Might as well not have been one! And they charge to have a fridge and microwave in the room

Summary Heading: Used to be a Holiday Inn...  little has changed
Summary: I was there for 2 nights for a small conference -   The good parts - the location is great, the rates are reasonable, and the bathrooms are decent sized, albeit a bit dated.  Water pressure is pretty good.  The not so great - aside from a few cosmetic touches, there hasn't been any updating to this property for many years.  The mattresses were noticeably very old and very uncomfortable. The food was adequate.  The temperature in the room was hard to maintain at a steady temp - even in mild weather.  As for the wifi - the speeds were almost unworkable - generally less than a MB both down and up - might as well have pulled out my old 56k modem.  I was told the owners moved away from being a Holiday Inn franchise to being an independent property because they wanted more control...

The HHB is in great proximity to the Bella Terra shopping center and is right off of Center Avenue which leads to Beach Blvd. We all know what's at the end of Beach Blvd-- the ocean. HHB provides friendly staff and a nice place to lay your head at a reasonable price. It's not directly by the beach but is an easy 10 minute drive (give or take 5 mins depending on typical Cali traffic). My only complaint is the that the indoor pool may need a cleaning (however I hear there was recent remodeling and dust flies... Anyways. Hot tub was wonderful and bar/lounge is chic. The boutique style lobby is amazing.

It took 3 trips to the front desk to get a key that would work, paint and caulking was missing in various parts of the bathroom and soap dish was falling off the wall. Carpet in the hallways and the room just seemed like they had been there a long, long time.  But the most disappointing moment was when my plane landed, I called for their courtesy van to pick me up; their response, our driver is sick, take a cab.  A$65.00 cab fare, one way. No apologies, no effort  to adjust anything.     The bed was good, the room was quiet; service and any caring for their guests -NONE

Stayed 6 nights and had a pleasant stay. Front desk and all hotel employees were courteous and friendly. Pictures of hotel and rooms on website are accurate. Hotel is centrally located and about 15 mins by car to the Huntington Beach Pier on Main Street. Also it is directly across from Bella Terra complex which houses several good restaurants and stores. Would recommend.

This is a nice hotel with lots of activity surrounding it. It is right off the 405 freeway and across the street from an outdoor mall with lots of dining options, Starbucks, Whole Foods, and various other high end shopping from which to choose. The upgraded rooms are much nicer than the older ones. The older rooms have very squeaky beds so when tossing and turning the sound of the bed defninitely woke me up. I had a room next to the laundry room...not a good idea! I didn't realize people like to do their laundry, LOUDLY, at 2 in the morning. Staff was friendly and I ate at the restaurant/bar located in the hotel. They have an indoor pool and fitness room but I didn't make it there on this business trip; maybe next time.

The night staff was really bitter and had no customer service ability at all. We asked for a trolley for our baggage and they told us to get it out of a closet and do it ourself. The motel 6 is better than this hipster wannabe, just save your money for the local theme parks or beaches.

The lobby was the nicest part of this hotel.  We checked in, was not informed of the continental breakfast.  We walked in our room and I was dismayed by the quality of the room.  The room and bathroom difinetly needs a remodel.  The shower had  hair on the wall.  I'm just disappointed especially for the price we paid.

Summary Heading: Noisy and the beds were uncomfortable
Summary: I had attended a wedding at Old World next door and stayed at the Hotel Huntington Beach since it was walking distance. It looked very trendy online and it was so when seen in person. The lobby was very "cool" looking with the decor and such. Staff was friendly and I was checked in right away. When entering the room, it was newly remodeled and was very "cool" looking. The furniture was kind of Ikea-ish which I liked. The beds, however were hard and not comfortable as well as the hallways were noisy and the room was not sound proof. I understand hearing a little noise from people walking in the hallway, but it was really loud and the people were just talking and not yelling.

Stayed here for 4/5 weeks on business..The staff were brilliant the Hotel is great ,rooms are cleaned spotlessly every day.Howard ( manager) cannot do enough for you .He really does go the extra mile. Well done to all the Howard and all his staff your a credit to the hotel.

The hotel was in the process of renovations.  I got one of the renovated rooms.  Very nice decor with clean lines.  The staff was pleasant.  Great Great location - right off the freeway.  Many eating establishments and mall with movie theater in short walking distance - even Costco!. Whole Foods just a couple blocks away but still within walking distance. Few things I didn't like: The hotel guide that shows local happenings and tv guide was from the previous month. Wifi was not immediate and took a couple calls to the front desk, but it did work eventually. The bed was super hard and the lighting was much too dark especially the bathroom.  I did mention these on my comment card and I was immediately contacted by the management that they had updated the hotel guide and would be

Summary Heading: Nice Make Over, Great new Gm, Exlnt Value
Summary: My wife and I work in the HB area, live in Laguna and have been coming here for years. For starters, the outside and inside have and are in the process of a complete made over, modernizing the place. We stay here about 4 times a year, most recently last week, when I got to meet the new GM and saw how focused he was on improving the Hotels image and I immediately noticed that many changes had already been implemented, especially his no nonsense bothersome Guest policy and smiling and helpful faces at the front desk. Some noisy guests were escorted out of the hotel during our stay, kudos on a quick response! The Resturaunt has improved dramatically and we love the new cuisine and chef. While you can easily walk across to Bella terra and get to shopping and Resturaunt, if you just

I've been staying here for almost two years now. My recent stay was great. Despite the negative comments, Huntington Beach Hotel has shown great improvement. Howard the new manager was incredibly welcoming and the staff was just as welcoming. The little quant trendy bar in the lobby is the bomb. It's SO convenient to the 405, shopping and the ocean. The price point compared to other hotels in the area.....no comparison. I'll definitely make Huntington Beach Hotel my regular place to stay while visiting So. California!

Summary Heading: OK for cheap, convenient stay. Needs Customer Service Overhaul!
Summary: My background - 41 year old female. Born and raised in Huntington Beach, now live in NYC last 13 years. Was home for a wedding and did not stay with the folks because me and the bf wanted privacy. Travel a lot. Stay in mostly 4 star hotels, rarely the 3 or 5 star.  Stayed 2 nights in October 2014  First the Pros and Cons.....  PROS:     The price was right.  LOCATION: This hotel is right of the 405 freeway. A major artery to access all the beach towns, Los Angeles, basically wherever you want to go in So Cal. But don't worry, no traffic noise. Nobody walks in LA, or Huntington Beach for that matter! You need a car in this town. So the fact that this Hotel is smack in the middle of Bella Terra is a plus. What is Bella Terra you ask? It basically a huge outdoor shopping mall with

This place is a joke. I wasn't treated well by the staff and I could have stayed at a motel at half the price and still would of had a better stay. If you smoke do not stay here, I went down to the parking lot  10 times to smoke, I was charged 150.00 for never smoking in the room. This place is all around a bad place to stay.

Stopped off for 1 night on our way to San Diego, be warned it's no where near the beach about 6 miles away. Not a problem though a good quality hotel close to freeway and there is a complex opposite with plenty of restaurants, bars and shops. Spent the day at  Huntington Beach before travelling to San Diego

1/4 the price of hotels on the beach. Recently remodeled. Close to the highway. Plenty of restaurants to choose from nearby. Would stay here again in a minute. I had to fly back to the east coast during our trip to California for a day and chose this place for my wife to stay while I was gone. Safety was a priority. Close enough to LAX and still gave her an opportunity to get some beach time in.

Although on arrival the hotel looks quite imposing it quickly becames evident that the public areas are well used and dirty in places. The hotel is undergoing (or has undergone) a revamp of the rooms. Our experience is that they are clean and tidy but the decor is very dark and the rooms are quite small although the windows are all massive. We stayed 3 nights at the end of August. After one night we asked to be moved because of the noise all night from air handling units, (probably for the pool or restaurant,) which were located directly below our room. There was no problem being moved although there still seemed to be a continual 'hum' to the hotel at night. Location is good, near the Interstate turnoff and directly across from Bella Terra Mall. It is probably some 4-5 miles

The hotel in being renovated.  We did stay in an already renovated room, so I think my concerns are valid. Negatives:    A/C didn't work - but moved us to new room    water didn't drain from tub during shower.    no refrigerator, though we had to sign paper at checkin saying we would pay for items in fridge (?)    lamps had no switch. had to struggle behind tables to find the dial on the cord to turn on and off. Positives:    great price.    great location. near restaurants, movies, WholeFoods. 5 minutes to the beach.    nice lobby & bar    friendly helpful staff

Summary Heading: Potential to be a great hotel but fails miserably
Summary: Our first reaction upon entering this Hotel was a good one.  It appeared to be a quaint boutique hotel.  Everything beyond the lobby is worn down and in need of repair.  The elevators are extremely concerning and we never really felt safe in them.  The hallways were hot, dirty and dingy.  The air conditioning units on each floor in the elevator waiting areas are all turned off, unplugged, and the knobs removed.  Apparently saving money is more important than guest comfort.    Our room had two double beds (as requested) and both were horrendously uncomfortable. The room was extremely dated and dirty.  The bathroom was disgusting with a dirty shower curtain and deep grime everywhere.  One thing that really unnerved me was a counter tent in the bathroom.  I will do my best to

I wouldn't rave about this place, they have a captive market as they are almost the only one in this particular area. We originally we're put on the 8th floor which is old and dated but the hot water didn't work so they moved us. I was annoyed because we had four nights there I felt we should have been given the newer room in the first instance as they were not booked out and the booking had been in place for weeks before we arrived. The new room was so much better, actually very nice with new modern decor. Don't bother with breakfast, it's really very basic as far as a buffet goes and the free continental is take away tiny muffins, an orange or apple and a cardboard cup coffee served outside the restaurant entrance. The other really annoying part was they charged my credit card

Summary Heading: Like a bad script from Candid Camera...
Summary: Read the bad reviews, went at our own risk.  NO bellman service. Nobody could speak audible ENGLISH.  When we took a shower, the drain was PLUGGED. Water over your ankles standing in shower.  Had to hold down the lever of the toilet FOR OVER A MINUTE so the toilet would flush.  The air conditioners run full speed. There is no control knob or temperature control. Your room gets ICE COLD in 10 minutes. Problem is after 15 minutes you get to experience what your body will feel like after you've passed away and STORED IN THE FRIDGE AT THE MORGUE.  Television didn't work. Upon leaving for dinner told the man at the front desk about it and was told, "WE'LL HAVE SOMEONE LOOK AT IT WHEN SOMONE IS IN THE ROOM". What does that mean?  Got back from dinner (9:30 pm) No television. They send

Summary Heading: Terrible service, very old rooms don't get misled
Summary: Two nights in a row this place got me, shame on me for going back. First night they lost my reservation and sold out so I got stuck in a hotel that is rented by the hour, the 2nd night the front desk clerk Michael couldn't have been less accommodating.  There are newer rooms and older rooms, 9 rooms were available that were new and unchecked in and he put me in an old room with 52 minutes to midnight as if all of the rooms would have been sold out.if you have booked this place and you can change it make sure you get a newer renovated room or don't go at all. Location is good next to bella terra but Michael shouldn't be in the hospitality business

The hotel seems great for the price, but there's many hidden details.  Check in stated 2pm, but after arriving it was posted as 3pm.  The lobby was great, but only had 1 working elevator at a given time.  The gal that checked us in gave no info and left us to figure everything out on our own.  We stayed on the 8th floor and it was horrible. The hallways were at least 90 degrees and the roof was leaking.  Huge water stained  ceiling in the halls and the carpet was soaking from the water dripping down and smelled of mold.  Looks like this leak had been there for some time.  The 8th floor  ice machine was also broken making it a hassle to get ice to fill the cooler as the room doesn't have a small fridge.  I would never book again at this hotel.

Looks like a Vegas hotel, really nice lobby ! We got a renovated room on the 6th floor beautiful clean and very modern, friendly staff, indoor outdoor pool w/ new lounge furniture, good food in the Resturant which was redone as well, what a great find,  they are definitely heading in the right direction, we stayed here for 3 nights and would book here again !!

Stayed there for my 21st birthday this past weekend, and it wasn't horrible but it wasn't good either. After already booking the room before I read reviews on the hotel I was a bit worried. You walk in and the lobby is pretty amazing. Very modern feel to it. After checking in and getting all our luggage my boyfriend and I were literally waiting for the elevators to arrive for 5 minutes! Finally the girl at the desk decided to inform us that only 1 of the 3 elevators worked. And our room was on the 8th floor so wasn't like it was easy to walk on the stairs. While walking to our room the ceiling in the hallway was leaking water and had mold all on top! Disgusting. Isn't that like a violation of some sort? Bar didn't open until 5 and the front desk told us 4. Room wasn't terrible.

Stayed here in 2009 for two nights and loved the location and price for a last minute booking and last two days of our overseas holiday.  Decided to book again for our honeymoon in 2013 as we wanted to get away from the heavy tourist areas and wind down after our longs weeks of travel. Love the laid back feel of Huntington and the beach. The hotel is directly across from a shopping centre, with cinema and restaurant. The room was newly refurnished and painted and was clean. The staff were friendly and assisted us with any questions/needs etc. Has a heated indoor pool, spa and a small gym area. A very short drive to the beach, Disney Land and baseball stadium.  Hallway was a little noisy at night (not the hotels fault, a junior sports team had booked out most rooms). The rooms in

Pro's - When you first walk in, the decor in the lobby was modern and attractive.  The rooms were also modern and up to date, complementary slippers.  Staff extremely professional/helpful.  Place was pretty quiet, across the street from a great movie theatre and nice shopping area. Free parking, free wifi.   Con's - Over price.  Extremly poor Internet connection. Some cleanliness issues.  Missing light bulb in the hallway of our room, the ceiling had a giant patched up area.  Drainage in bathtub was very slow, leakaging faucet, only 2 towels for a room of 4?  The only reason I gave this hotel 3 points instead of 2 is that the customer service of the front desk was super which is absolutely commendable.

Seriously. There are three machines, an elliptical and two cycles. Guess how many worked? ZERO. The elliptical had an enormous battery sitting in the cup holder and there was circuitry exposed on the menu surface. The bench was warped, causing an unsafe seat for lifts as well. There's not even a treadmill... Seriously.   We stayed on the 7th floor which looks worse than a 3star hotel room. The only reason we stayed at this place is the mall next door and it's misleading luxurious looking exterior and lobby. Don't judge a book by its cover.

I wouldn't come back to this hotel. The smoke alarm chirps every 8 hours. Service was non responsive. We requested a coffee refill packet three times over the coarse of 12 hours before it was finally delivered to our room.   Pros - the hotel is nicely located next to a beautiful shopping center.

Summary Heading: Best western blows this place away
Summary: Yep like everyone else says....lobby area...wow....get off elevater pretty bad....walk into room...bummed out. Tv phone and toilet all broke but they did come fix except phone. Bathroom door does not lock. We go down for our free  breakfast walk into another fancy room looks like a restraunt and the guy says oh no this is 12 bucks free breakfast is behind you. We turn around to a coffee maker basket of fruit and tiny muffins. Nothing for kids to drink. Stayed at the best western night before and that blew this place away. Ya find elsewhere.

Rooms nice size.  TV did not work, hair dryer electrical outlet did not work.  No towels at the pool.  Called front desk and they did address all above items in a timely manner.  No triple AAA membership accepted.

Boy was I surprised – I’ll be sticking to the chains from now on!  First of all, when we checked in the hotel was hot. All the public parts of the hotel felt like they not only didn’t have the air on but may have had the heat on.  When we got checked into the room the air had not been turned on so it took around two hours for the room to get to bearable temperature. Really disappointed with the whole experience. I read the reviews before booking that weren't amazing but weren't terrible. We were traveling with 3 children and have family in the area so we weren't trying to be super picky about where we stayed since we wouldn't be spending much time at the hotel. The night we checked in there was a huge wedding reception and people were flooded in the lobby, there was a lot going on the lobby smelt terrible and the staff wasn't super accommodating to the arriving guest. They just handed me a room key with the room number on it gave no other information about room service, restaurtant, pool gym locations ect.. just sent me on our way.
