Summary Heading: Could be so much better- disappointing.
Summary: The photos seen prior to my booking and the reception area when I arrived are totally un-representative of the room I stayed in.  The bed was very roughly made when I arrived, but was better on latter nights.  The pillows the lumpiest I have found apart from a budget motel.  The room itself was just very very tired.  The bathroom had no plugs in either the bath OR the sink which seems ridiculous in an area currently suffering from drought. The shower temperature was uncontrollable. There were some minor issues with cleanliness. There is a complimentary breakfast offered, but this is limited to coffee, apples and some tiny muffins.  The paid breakfast is not recommended as value for money or quality.  On the plus side, the hotel has a quiet policy in the room agreement, which I

There's really nothing wrong, but nothing great, with this hotel.  The staff was fine, we got into our room a little early.  My main objection was in the shabbiness of the room.  The lobby looked pretty fancy, but the room itself was in need for a thorough dusting and paint job.  There was also an annoying lack of mirrors and I had to stand on the edge of the tub to look at my outfit - not exactly safe.   The location, across from the mall, was very convenient.  Unfortunately an alarm started going off at 2:30 am, but they apologized when we checked out and comped the refrigerator charge (which was delivered on our request).  I would stay there again if it were convenient.

When we first arrived at "the hotel" I was surprisingly impressed. The lobby was clean and modern. Only if I knew that the lobby would be the only plesent area on this trip. We checked in and headed up to our rooms on the 8th floor. As soon as we stepped off the elevator I could tell that the whole hotel was not as top notch as the lobby. The hallway was dirty and smelled. The paint was chipping and the only sign of life was the dim hum of the 10 year old vending machine. As we got to our room we found the room looked not at all like the avertised on the website. The first thing I noticed after rushing into the bathroom after a long car ride was the door. The lobby/lounge was really nice. They have newer rooms, you can stay in but if you bring your dog, like we did they won't let you stay. It's about 5-6 miles from the beach but they have some shopping and a movie theater across the way. If you stay a day or 2 you should be fine. They will eventually have to update all the rooms and make it a bit more pet friendly. The two front desk clerks were nice when I copped a bit of an attitude from booking issues. One was Michael I forgot the girl's name, both were very professional. Hopefully, I will get my money refunded for having to switch to an older room because of my pet, will let reviewers no if something goes wrong w/that. Their advertised rooms not what you get. They smell funny and, linens don't smell clean. Horrible stay. Don't expect what they advertise. Lobby looks nice but once on your floor it smells and isn't a place I would stay ever again.

When staying here I was checked into a room that smelled like mold and had very worn out furniture.  This use to be a wonderful hotel but now seems like the management does not care like they use to.  The hotel is in a great location and has great potential.

The hotel looks very modern and clean on the outside - especially judging by the website pictures, but the rooms are awful. In particular the bathroom. Really old and dirty. Mini-tiled floor with more grout lines than tiles . . . a harbinger of dirt and germs.  The worst part is the soundproofing. You can hear every single thing from the rooms next door and the corridor outside. The party room/bar downstairs is extremely loud too. It was impossible to sleep. We were woken up at least 8 times throughout the night due to noises.  We booked two nights and only stayed one. When I complained they did not offer a refund or even apologise.  Do NOT stay at this hotel. It was a nightmare.

Check the web site and this place looks nice.  The rooms however are nothing like what is depicted on the website.  When asked, the front desk responds "some rooms are nice, some are not"  Not very helpful post check in.   Cons: very old and dingy rooms Night shift front desk was unhelpful, unapologetic and borderline rude High speed internet is .3 Mbps BEST case.  Barely useful if you're working. Very low water pressure.   Again - old rooms - no plugs anywhere! The back of the hotel looks directly into an office tower and right over the giant AC units.   Beds old and stiff - no blankets in bed except for top sheet and "comforter"  NOT what you see in the picture. No additional linens,  pillows, or blankets in the room -   Pros: Plenty of other hotels nearby.  Wouldn't stay here.

Conveniently located. Good value for southern California. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Facility showing signs of lack of maintenance. Non working ice machine for 4 days on our floor. Lamps in poor condition and need replacing. My pet peeve of low wattage lighting rears its head again. Shower control had slow leak. No major concerns just lack of attention to small problems. These could be easily corrected.

The Lobby and outside area is very nice. It's close to a huge shopping area and right near the 405Fwy. However, the room was just okay--furniture all scratched up, bathrooms are needing to be fixed. I can't stand hotels that have the coffee maker in the bathroom. Who's going to make coffee while you're sitting on the John?   Worst of all--Hard bed. It's like sleeping on the ground. I will not be returning to this Hotel again.

We are currently undergoing renovations to our guest rooms and will be replacing the furniture and beds to match the style of our lobby and the rest of the hotel.  We currently have 2 floors complete and will be continuing with the renovations to the rest of our guest rooms.  I hope that you will give us another chance once our renovations are complete.  Thank you for your understanding.  Management-

Summary: The hotel is in the process of refurbishing the rooms. We were on the 8th floor and our room had new beds and other furniture but was still nothing special. The lobby was attractive and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hot breakfast was nice. It was only a 20 minute drive to Disneyland.

The lobby and main areas are quite nice and well kept.  However, the guest rooms are not nearly as nice.  The beds were the worst hotel beds I have ever had and while the room was clean overall it was definitely dated and showed its age, cracked tiles, seperating caulking in the bathroom, older worn carpet.  The pool was OK but too cold and lacked any real anti-skid surface around it making it rather unsafe to walk on when wet.  The breakfast was great and service was great.

Summary: We went to SoCal to celebrate a friend's birthday at the Olde World complex across the street and this property was recommended due to the ease of walking distance and not driving after having a few adult beverages.  Olde World has to be this hotel's saving grace! The rooms (7th floor) are old, dingy and absolutely disgusting from a cleanliness standpoint. Summary Heading: Worst Design Flaw I Have EVER Seen In A Hotel Room
Summary: Worst design flaw I have EVER seen in a hotel room...window coverings that ONLY COVER PART OF THE WINDOW! Please see attached picture and understand that what you see is the FULLY CLOSED position. I know it is hard to believe, but these blinds do not close all the way. They can either be opened all the way, or closed in a manner in which 50% of the window gets covered. This is crazy! All kinds of light comes through, starting at sunrise, making it very difficult to sleep! This alone could have earned them a 1 rating, but I was gracious, because the hotel overall is a 2.5.  The lobby was nice and the hotel had fresh paint, but still the same old rooms underneath these cheap upgrades. Bed was worn-out, lumpy, and stiff! Room was clean, but the bathroom wasn't.
Manager Response: Actually, windows do close all the way.  The shades are overlapping each other in he picture you displayed.  If you were to pull the draw string, the shades will move and cover the remaining part of the window.    I apologize that you were unable to operate the shades. Summary Heading: UP DATED ROOMS-- DIDN'T FINISH THE JOB
Summary: They charge extra for updated rooms [check what you sign]. They didn't inform us it was more. Bad lighting, toilets don't flush, tub and sinks go down very slow be careful sink over flows. No vents or fan in bathroom. Also TV had very bad reception. Forth floor has no air conditioning, no ice machine that works and vending machine is not cold. We stayed five nights for wedding.Thought they would be guest friendly and give discount for all the issues, no deal.

Summary: We didn't know what to expect. But it was better than the reviews. The room was nicer the beds were comfy. And close to restaurants, stores and movie theater. Make sure to visit the bar. The drinks are worth it.

Back again and pleased again.  The front desk and shuttle staff make this hotel.  It does need some updates but the value wins out.  This time out free shuttle service driver to the airport was great.  As a kind gesture, he wanted to be fair with the amount we were to tip and took the extra kindness to be fair.  Wonderful people, place, and stay!

Summary Heading: Don't let the lobby fool you
Summary: The lobby has clearly been updated and is very nice, however nothing else at the hotel is. The rooms were dated, musty and sceeved me out. There was no mini fridge. I was okay with dealing with the room for one night, but became increasingly annoyed wheni attempted to use the pool and gym. Not a single machine worked in the gym. All electronically broke ith the mirror also broken. The pool looked like it had not been treated in weeks - very cloudy and not a single chair out for guests. I was thoroughly disappointed as this was our first night of vacation. If they continue to renovate the rest of the hotel like the lobby, then maybe I'd think about returning.

When I called down to the front desk(after ringing and ringing and ringing) to get a taxi, the little man on the end of the line paused and said "wait are you room 501??" told us there were complaints that we were being loud and we needed to be quiet. The walls are extremely thin. After calling down multiple times we never got a cab. Finally we went down to the lobby where we were ignored by both of the men at the front desk. There was another group of guys in the lobby drinking beers and the front desk guy made a stink saying they couldn't drink in the hotel lobby and they needed to throw them away immediately. The man then came

We stayed here for 3 nights while our house was being treated for termite. We have to pay a little extra to stay on level 6 or above because these room are renovated. We got two rooms on level 8 over looking Costco.  The room was clean, there is self coffee maker in the bathroom. They offer a full breakfast for $ 11.95, we didn't buy the package since we are local and have a car.  The hotel is located across the street from Bella Terra with movie threatres, eatery and few shops like Kohls, World Market, REI and Barnes and Noble. There is also Buca right next door.  It is easy access to 405 Freeway. And 10 minutes away from "Little Saigon" where you can Vietnamese's foods.

We stayed here for a night while my daughter participated in a soccer tournament over the weekend.  It reminded me of hotels from the 80's or 90's in look and feel.  But, everything was clean, room was fine, (small) bar/lounge served ice-cold beer and location was great for walking over to Bella Terra outdoor mall and hanging out for hours.

Summary Heading: Depends On What Floor You Get
Summary: We did not opt for the updated room and our room was terrible.  We arrived the room was musty we attempted to turn in the air conditioning and it was the window type unit from motels 20 years ago.  No thermostat in these rooms.  The unit was missing a knob, but one arrived quickly.  We turned on the unit and well we left the room.  The carpet was old, the bed was economy, the bathroom outdated, need I say more.  I traveled over 100 nights a year for many years and the floor and room we were on mirrored a motel 6.  We had free breakfast and after one morning we went to the local McDonald's instead.  When the hotel is 100% remodel it could have potential, but until then I recommend you find another hotel.

On business in Southern California and used a booking service that selected this hotel.   The rooms are decorated circa 1980, as are the age of the sheets, the television, the maintenance.  The air conditioner was the loudest I have ever heard. I was forced to attempt to sleep through it's 747 roar or sweat to death.  The walls are thin.    Despite above- it was not terrible and it was cheap. Right by Costco. Parking is good.

Summary Heading: Great location close to shops and restaurants
Summary: The staff were friendly and accommodating I ugraded to a king suite with great view ..walked to old village and to shops and restaurants . The room was large and comfortable. I liked the underground parking judy jones san diego

My buddy and I stayed here for 3 nights/4 days.  The hotel was very nice.  It is very conveniently located right off the 405.  This makes it extremely easy to get on and off the freeway to go to LA, other area beaches, or San Diego.  Lots of nice restaurants and fast food places near by.  Also a target right down the street and a shopping mall right across the street.  It takes about 15-20 mins to get down to Huntington Beach depending on the traffic, but is an easy drive.  The room was ok.  Nothing fancy, but it was clean (and felt clean).  There aren't any mini-fridges though unless you want to pay to rent one.  We just bought a bin at Target and filled it up with ice everyday to keep things cold.  All in all, it was a great place for the price and conveniently located.

Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it was opposite a shopping centre and many restaurants. it also had quick access to the freeway and the beach resorts by car (20 minute drive). The room was clean , although not particularly modern. The pool area was very dark and not very welcoming, not least because it was overlooked by the restaurant. Other than that, an enjoyable stay.

Can not believe how unprofessional they are at this establishment.  We had reservations for the Sunday brunch with our family including relatives visting from out of town.  We made our reservations over a week in advance and they have the nerve to call us the day of our reservation  just one hour before out reserved time to tell us that they over booked and had to cancel our reservation!

I had a renovated room which was clean and spacious.  Parking and Internet are free.  There's no frig which was a bit disappointing but maybe I've gotten spoiled.  You have to sign a a few papers when you check in, one is about "quiet hours" which I think was from 10-7.  I checked in at 830pm on a Friday night and the club was rocking out.  There was a huge wait for the elevator as a bus full of people checked in right before me and every time someone came out of the club my ears literally hurt.  My room was on the 8th floor and at 1am the club was still going because I had the pleasure of falling asleep to a rocking bass that shock the floor. Everything else was fine, I didn't spend much time on the room.

Walking in to the hotel and the lobby blew me away Super nice modern clean lines , i really love the lights ! We got a newly renovated room which was so nice clean and modern,the hotel is right next to an open mall lots of shopping and dinning options.I would definitely stay here again , ask for the a renovated rooms for sure !

Upon arrival late at night on a Tuesday, I noticed the lobby was loud from the bar. Every Tuesday they have salsa dancing lessons. The room was very old and appeared that they tried to clean it, but it was too far gone. Carpet was very dingy from years of spills, wear and tear and maybe a hot iron on the floor. I found out later that some rooms have been renovated as has the lobby area, which is what I call IKEA cheap. So, ask for the renovated, get a good rate and probably be okay with this property.

The customer service at this hotel is awful.  They are both unhelpful (the front desk could not answer simple questions) and incompetent (they incorrectly charged my credit card for an additional night).  I'm pretty easy-going, but these people are terrible at their jobs.  I've traveled around the country staying at a range of different hotels, and this was the only one that has driven me to complain out of sheer frustration.  Room service was supposed to be open until 9pm one night; I called at 8:30pm and they said they were already shut.  Also, apparently, the fire alarm goes off a lot.  There are other things, but I won't bother going into them -- just wanted to say, this is one of those hotels to stay away from -- you'll save yourself some big headaches!

The lobby is very nicely decorated, the rooms are very dated.  We stayed three nights, only had nice hot water for a shower the first morning.  Nice location. The price was right, so I would probably stay again.  The room was clean and the staff was always friendly.

I Stayed 2 nights in this hotel, the first time I came here, it really good location with good weather. The hotel was nice but breakfast not good with bad staff. my room was cleaned every day. Shopping, dinning very easy to arrive at. I will be back.

This is my third time staying with these kind people and I leave more excited than my first experience.  The front desk staff make you feel as if you are coming home each time you enter. All are wonderful but this time, Jose was particularly helpful.  The shuttle service can't be beat and the morning breakfast, while basic, is a treat. Shopping, dining, and beach access are all very easy to arrive at.  I love the art (for sale) throughout the hotel lobby.  Good job Hotel Huntington Beach!  May business boom in the new year!  I WILL be back!"

Everyone was very friendly (although I did not like the bouncer in the bar - there were only about 8 of us and all were over the age of 45, and he acted like we were a bunch of problem children, puffing his chest out, trying to be intimidating). It is walking distance from Bella Terra with great shopping and restaurants but most notably is what matters to me the most. Its extremely affordable without sacrificing aesthetics.  By staying inland HB and enjoying a comfortable bed and spacious room with more than ample amenities, you save about $80 for a less quality hotel closer to pch. It doesn't meet flush to the flooring when you exit. The last elevator to the right is inoperable.   The hotel has NO central air so it smells like an old bar and smokey as ever! The halls on many floors were run down and dark. Wallpaper was peeling and you could see black mold. The ice makers had missing fronts which you see as soon as you exit the elevators. The food at the banquet was the quality of a Denny's so was acceptable however disappointing.  I would not recommend the hotel as there are other hotels in the area much nicer for the same price.

OK. I read all the reviews and was expecting real problems. Someone else booked this for me so I had no choice. I was really surprised in a good way. The remodeled room was good (some peeled paint on ceiling and dust on top of mirrors and bed ledges). I am very picky, but the staff was great, the room was clean and comfortable. I found people accomodating. GIL went out of his way to make our stay very good. The staff offered to print our boarding passes.  I hate malls but Terra Bella is beautiful with free concerts every night and a plethora of restaurants. My wife and I went to Whole Foods (walking distance) and Starbucks for breakfast. Don't forget to walk to the college campus which is beautiful.

Summary Heading: This is a bait and switch type of hotel
Summary: I booked it for the location ~near an outdoor mall and 8 miles to the beach~ and I was unhappy the whole time. I will be calling travelocity to complain and arrange for different accommodations A.S.A.P.

I left the lights on in my rental car twice, both times the front desk staff went out of their way to help me jump start the car. Saved me a lot of money. Great guest service. The rooms are clean and the hotel is close to everything.

Summary: This hotel is a quiet hidden jewel of HB. We only stayed one night during our travels (it is located right off the freeway) but we will definitely be repeat visitors. There is a ton to do in that part of the ton- all in walking distance. You would think with it being so close to the outdoor shopping plaza "Bella Terra" that it would be noisy but that was not the case. We had a great night sleep and the staff was more than pleasant! The room keepers were very smiley and friendly. The rooms were spacious and gorgeously updated. The mattresses felt new (no springs detected!) and the pillows were plump. The bathroom amenities were fair sized and parking was even good.

Summary Heading: Another stay, slight update to my previous review

Off brand cereal, my wife had the Cheerios, except they weren't Cheerios, they were some awful generic brand.  The OJ was watered down... all in all, not worth the $5. Summary Heading: Good value - convenient but not exciting.
Summary: I stayed here on business - very short walk to the nearby office buildings and Bella Terra with a large movie multiplex and plenty of restaurants and shopping.  Very convenient access to the 405 freeway, but no noise problems.  Generally quiet area.  Lobby has recently been renovated, but in a completely different style from the rooms - strange!   Definitely make sure you're in a newly renovated room.  Rooms are comparable to a mid-priced chain, but the price is lower.  Wifi internet is pretty slow.  I stayed there for the price and the convenience, and the staff was friendly enough.  If you're looking for the beach or party atmosphere - this hotel doesn't have it. I have stayed at this hotel a few times.  Hotel HB is in a great location with lots of food and shopping nearby, but the hotel itself seems to get worse every time I stay.  The hotel is kind of old and dirty, and seems as if there is minimal maintenance going on with the hotel.  The internet in the hotel is horrible.  Just nothing good to say about this place.  Definitely won't stay here again.

Summary Heading: We had a good stay - we will return!
Summary: We had an enjoyable experience while staying at Hotel Huntington Beach from 718-7/24/11. The hotel is currently going through some renovation, but in spite of this, the staff helped to make our visit comfortable.  They were cordial about working out details of our visit. We also had a tasty breakfast there each day. We have been going there for many years, and each time the staff has helped us have a pleasant stay. We will be going back there again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a great location!
Summary: This is the second time I've stayed here, and for the price, this hotel is a great value in a great, central location.  I lived in Huntington Beach for over 20 years, and now travel there to visit family and friends, so I find this location to be ideal.  Easy access to everything, including the freeway (but without the noise).  Yes, staying at the beach would be nice, but at 3 to 4 times the cost, and honestly, for my purposes, staying at the beach is less convenient in terms of access to everything.  One can walk to the Bella Terra Mall from the hotel for shopping, movies and restaurants.  There is a large 24 Hour Fitness Sport Club sharing the same overall parking lot which is handy as well. Summary Heading: They make many promises, none of which they keep.

When we arrived, the lobby was still under renovation & the pool & hot tub were still closed.  The rooms were small.  We were promised fridges in every room, only 3 families got a fridge.  I requested a room with 2 queen beds as there were 4 of us in the room; I was not told that this would be a problem upon booking.  This hotel has only king or doubles, so my request at check-in was denied & I spent all 3 nights enduring a WWF match with my restless, sleeping daughter.

Summary Heading: Dirty and Aged, but kind, understanding staff
Summary: The room was dirty, that is the bathroom had goo running down the tiles and the table surfaces in the bedroom had clearly not been cleaned. Summary Heading: Great value, excellent service, premium location, great Sunday brunch
Summary: Service: extraordinary!  Everyone was super nice and friendly and wanted to make my stay as good as it could possibly be!   Room: It wasn't too big or fancy, but it was still nice.  The bed was comfortable and there really wasn't anything wrong Location: The Bella Terra mall was within walking distance and that was really fun to check out.  And it's a short drive to the wonderful Huntington Beach, which is so much better and cleaner than Redondo, Manhattan, and Hermosa Beach.  Not to mention Disneyland is close by! Price:  The price is significantly lower than other hotels around here, so that was a major point in my stay here rather than others Other: I stayed for the Sunday Brunch and that was one of the surprising highlights.  They had unlimited king crab legs, champagne, and

no jacuzzi its a whirlpool with no bubbles with cold water, furnature is rundown and worn out!  our room was not finished when the maid was done. no sheets on the the bed or pillow cases, all of the bedding was on the floor in a heap! the exersize room was a couple of bikes! we chose this hotel for the sparkling indoor pool and jacuzzi and it was very dirty and rundown, my wife wouldnt go in for fear of infection!

Great hotel! The decor is a little outdated, but you can't find anything else wrong with this place. Spotless, no bad smells, comfy beds and great staff. They have a hotel bar (not the best bartender, but great happy hour) and buffet breakfast that is huge!  4 miles from beach.  Would definitely stay again.

Great value at $89.00 a night! Have no complaints, convenient of interstate location, free parking, nice mall with Starbucks across the street, Oktoberfest a cute Bavarian village next door. Much better than average free breakfast. Rehearsal dinner for wedding utilized banquet facilities, service there average.

After having read some of the negative reviews on this hotel, we thought it necessary to give our opinions. We have stayed here at least 5 or 6 times while in Orange County. We have ALWAYS found the staff to be very friendly, helpful and accomodating! Of course the hotel is not on the beach- look at the rates!!! It is well located to many attractions, close to the beach, and within walking distance of restaurants and shopping. Be sure to pay a few $$ extra for a remodeled room. They are very nice and a good value. We plan on staying there on our next trip to Southern  California!

Summary Heading: Fantastic Service. Lavish, newly remodeled room at reasonable price.
Summary: What a soothing end to a long trip.  I found myself traveling in the Huntington Beach area after dealing with the funeral of my beloved father. My husband and I were distress, tired and anxious when we found the Hotel Huntington Beach.  The staff was fantastic, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the many activities in the surrounding community.  We were given a beautiful, newly remodeled room that rivaled the other high cost hotels that I stay at on during business trips.  The bed was so comfortable I didn't want to leave it behind.  In addition to long days at the beach we enjoyed shopping and dining across the street from the hotel at Belle Terre a quaint town square type business area that was a fun place to explore in the evening.  Each afternoon or evening when we

I stayed at this hotel last night.  Like most people have written, some of the decor is a bit dated, but the room was clean, and there were touches of luxury.  I had no problems connecting to the WiFi in my room on the 6th floor, once I found the right network on my laptop, which was simple.  The bed was clean and comfortable.    Here is a tip-I had planned a stay at a hotel just down the street where I was to receive a rate of $76.00.  I called the Hotel Huntington Beach, told them about that reservation  and asked them directly for what the best rate they could give me was-and I got the room for $75.00 + tax.   So, be sure to call ahead of time and see if you can get a better deal than what they offer   online. I would definitely stay here again!   Also, Bella Terra Shopping

DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL, bad customer service, very out dated and dirty. Trust me go one block further to Comfort Suites and if you are out of town this is not close to the beach. I had a signed contract by Tony the Sales Manager of the hotel confirming a block of rooms I had for my wedding and I find out the day before by Phillip the new Sales Manager, Tony was demoted because of plenty of mistakes like this and sorry but there are no rooms for you and your party. We had out of town guests and were left hanging, not what I wanted the day before my wedding. Anyway long story but at the end of it all they did nothing to make up for the error and pretty much made me feel like they could've cared less, they would have made $1k from must my guests in rooms alone INSANE. They

I stayed here for a few days just before Thanksgiving.  We weren't in the hotel much but when we were, we enjoyed it.  The beds were comfortable and the water pressure and temperature in the showers great.  The only possible problem with the showers, was that the shower head was low, but this didn't effect me.  The AC unit was a little noisy but at the end of the day seemed like nothing more than white noise and I was able to sleep with no problem.  On our last morning at the hotel we tried the hotel's buffet breakfast.  The fruit was delicious and fresh, but otherwise the hotel served an average buffet, nothing outstanding.

We have just returned from California, great place and lovely sunshine.  Stayed at the Huntington Beach Hotel.  We found the hotel dated in the decor even though the room we were upgraded to had just been refurbished. It would appear to be a hotel that has weekend functions with many of the guests staying over which allowed for noisy antics well into the early hours.  The walls were paper thin so everything could be heard ... and I mean everything.  The brochure pictures look like the pool is outdoors - it isn't and the seating area near the indoor pool is more of a pathway at the back of the hotel with 4/5 sun-beds The fully equipped gym consisted of two seated bike machines. The room itself was clean, the decor just updated with green carpets, mustard yellow walls with accents

The staff was friendly, fast, and accommodating. However, this hotel needs some serious updating.  Some minor changes would be nice...such as a revamp of the front lobby, which is very Love Boat-looking, and climate-wise, is strangely warmer than outside -- even when the outside is hot and humid like it was when we stayed.  The hotel is absolutely no frills.  Bed, bathroom, basic amenities.  We didn't go to the pool because it seemed like there were quite a few teenagers with their families heading over there, and also because we were short on time.   There is free wireless Internet, which was a plus.  Our bed was comfortable, but it was just the duvet and a sheet and another blanket, and that was it (no fluff here).  Bathroom was monotonous beige/white, even though I think they

Overall, a great hotel for a great price.  It was immediately off the interstate by a large mall and only 15 minutes from the beach.  The only problem with the location is we had to take a different road to get to the hotel from the beach because we could not turn left from the main road due to the interstate traffic exiting at that intersection.  The room was clean and quiet, and the bed was very comfortable.  The employees at the front desk did not speak English very well and had to ask someone to help with our questions.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience.  Would recommend it to anyone.  (One note-the ocean water is very cold!)  Monica J. from Northern Kentucky

Our family travel to Southern CA, we found this Friendly & Nice Hotel, all the staffs are very friendly and helpful, room are very clean, price are very reasonable, they have a very nice indoor swimming pool. We are very enjoy while we were there, and we will be back to stay this hotel again.

If you enjoy sleeping with bed bugs, this is the hotel for you! Otherwise STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!! It is infested with bed bugs in every room. I visible saw bugs in my first room, switched rooms, and that didn't help I woke up with bites all over my body.  AGAIN STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!

PROS:  The hotel was an affordable value, right off the freeway.  It's not close to the beach like you might think.  But the drive to the beach is a straight shot down the road--about a 10 minute drive.  There are lots of places to eat in the area.  An upscale mall (Bella Terra) is next door and has a movie theater.  I enjoyed eating at Cheesecake Factory.  Parking at the hotel was easy and close.  Hotel staff was very friendly.  CONS:  I booked a non-smoking room.  Unfortunately, when I got there, the entire 4th floor smelled like smoke.  Our room was no better.  We called the front desk to see if we were accidentally placed in a smoking room. They said no.  We inquired why it would smell so awful in the room and the entire floor.  We were advised that their hotel staff often

The lobby is beige, the staff wear beige, the corridoors are beige - rooms Beige BEIGE BEIGE BEIGE and more beige.  When you enter this hotel you notice the weird Greek furnature which is loud and over the top for such a non over the top property.  The rooms are just dated, tired, worn.  Great housekeeping I must say but that is where the goodness ends.  Move on!

I stayed at the Hotel Huntington Beach for 5 nights in Jan 2008.  I did not find any problems with the hotel.  I stayed on the 6th floor.  Check in went extremely fast without any problems.  The room was very clean.  The bed was VERY comfortable and the lined very nice.  The carpet is worn throughout the hotel and in need of replacing.  But it was vacuumed daily.  The bathroom was kept clean.  There is some paint chipping and maybe some grout stained but it is not a 5 star hotel either.  For the price it is nice 3 star hotel.  The exercise room is definitely in need of work though.  It has 2 recumbent bikes and some miss matched dumbbells.  I never did workout there. The hotel does have free passes to the Balley’s gym about 2 miles south.  I don’t think anyone had informed the

This hotel has seen better days . Bathroom tiles were broken and cracked with much mildue in the grouts . Very limited TV selections - but overpriced movies are available , " free  wireless internet " is almost impossable to connect to - but pay computers are available in the lobby . Lights in the room were of such low wattage it was difficult to read . I got the feeling that managment was milking this hotel for all it could get . I would never stay again nor would  I recommend it to anyone .

Summary Heading: Not a 3 star filthy smelly horrible
Summary: Stayed here Aug 2007.  Apparently this is a former Holiday Inn built 30 years ago and NOT CLEANED OR UPDATED IN 30 YEARS!  The first N/S room we were issued reeked badly of smoke, had stained, outdated wallpaper, ratty and worn bedcoverings, torn adn stained carpet of an unknown original color.  "Phillip" at the front desk was polite and professional and issued us a second room on a different floor.  Unfortunately that room was in the same worn, condition and smelled dirty rather than smoky.  "Phillip" issued us a third room on fourth floor which was somewhat updated to a 1980s style but was similarly worn and smelled of mildew.  Since we knew all other hotels in the area were booked, we accepted this room.  Backing up to our arrival: Despite providing the staff with our

Summary Heading: An education my 9 year old didn't need!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel (with my 9 year old daughter and niece) as part of a large Irish dance group who had an all day competition the next day. The hotel first demonstrated a complete lack of good judgment when they placed us in a room surrounded by rowdy young adults (the pink hair was a pretty good clue as to their potential behavior). They proceeded to get drunk and spent the entire night yelling down the halls, slamming doors, and banging headboards (with exaggerated sound effects to thank us for our requests for quiet). I was on the phone to security every 1-2 hours, which was an absolutely worthless effort. My daughter was woken up every couple of hours (which did impact her next day's performance) and I never slept at all. The hotel's apology consisted of a 50% discount,

We stayed here for our Honeymoon from 6/27 thru 7/1. We got there and were a little confused about parking b/c it was for those who had  "parking permits" only. We just parked and I went inside. They said that it was ok & checked me in, gave me the keys and permit.  The hotel was very nice and the staff was helpful. We were on the 5th floor and had a decent view. The rooms was well stocked with towels/soap/shampoo and the A/C worked wonders. The room was clean, however was a little dingy. I was wondering what made it look that way, then I noticed the carpet.  The carpet was clean, but with the many years of people trampling all over it, it was time for new carpeting. My new white socks didn't get blackened for dirty, so I know it was clean. It just was worn-out.  We still loved

Summary Heading: Experience here was different than I had hoped
Summary: Overall, my experience was okay. I stayed here for my anniversary. When we called on our way, we were told that our room was ready and we could check in early. When we got our key and went up to the room, we opened the door and the room was a mess. So either room service hadn't gotten to it, or the previous guest was still staying in that room. So why would the hotel tell us that the room is ready when it wasn't? And then when I went down to tell them, they put us in a different room. But this next room was already being used by a guest. So we got placed in a third room. I was already frustrated with the hotel, and this was supposed to be a romantic weekend for my wife and I. It was in a decent location, but I'm not sure if I would stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel, while visiting some family in Huntington Beach. A week later after returing home from our trip, We started getting red ichy spots. We went to the doctor and found out we had contracted bed bugs! My advice to you is first, don't stay at this hotel. Second, at any hotel you saty at,  look at the mattress for any stains coming down the sides. We thought is was coffee stains at first, but the stains were down both sides of the mattress. We did find it to be unusual, and very unsanitary, but we were only there for one night. Apparently these bed bugs leave blood stains behind.

Summary Heading: Totally Fine hotel, plus free prkg & wi-fi internet & indoor pool
Summary: The rooms are a little outdated & plain, but I think it was totally fine, esp since "nicer" hotels regularly charge $15/nite for prkg and/or $10 per 24 hr. period for internet hookup. Both were free here. The breakfast I had one day & it was nothing special except they had a guy for made to order omeletes & big belgian waffles.

Summary Heading: It is what it is.... and nothing more
Summary: This is a budget hotel. I was there on business and for $75 a night., I did not expect much and was neither really disappinted nor was I surprised. Rooms are marginally clean and updated. The staff is pleasant enough. The location is very central to many business' in the OC and so I couldnt complain too much.  I will say that while I was there, neither the wi-fi nor the business center computer worked so I did downgrade from a neutral rating. If you want a cheap bed in a decent location in Huntington Beach, this may be the place for you.l

Summary Heading: Staff was excellent and I enjoyed my meals.
Summary: After seeing some of the reviews here it is difficult to imagine it was the same place I stayed at for over a week.  I was out of town recovering from some recent surgery.  I couldn't go home because I had to stay for doctor followup.  In other words, I spent most of my time in my room.  It was adequate for my needs.  Had free wireless connect.  Had a refrigerature put in the room for only $10.  But, the staff was outstanding.  Everyone was great!

We spent two nights in this hotel and wouldn't go back.  The plumbing in the room was a mess - the bathtub ran and underneath the sink leaked, splashing your feet.  The buffet breakfast was the worst I've ever been to.  It looked like they haven't invested a dime in this building since it's been built.

The hotel looks nice from the outside..how deceiving.  It needs a complete overhaul.  Perhaps knocking it down and rebuilding would be better.  The boxsprings (if you could call them so) were filthy and full of holes.  The a/c did not work and we had to be moved to another room at 3:00 a.m.  The hallways are hot, stuffy and miserable.  The elevator closed on my daughter and we had to pull her free and allow the luggage cart to go in without us.  I'm sure a Motel 6 would seem like a 5-star rating next to this dump.

This is by far one of the worst hotel, I have ever stayed in.  It was rated 3-Star by AAA and Hotels.com.  I have no idea why.  My room was in poor state.  The wallpaper was pealing off the wall.  The lamp fixtures were broken and the carpet was stained.  I could almost tolerate all of these problems until it was time for me to take a shower.  I turned on the shower and nothing came out so I decided to clean myself up in the sink.  The stopper did not work and sink did not hold the water.  This hotel is prime location and convienent to alot of nice shopping areas.  I hope renovations are under way if not they need to do it soon.

The outside of the hotel would lead you to believe that the inside may be just as nice. Make sure you ask to see a room before checking in.  We had two chairs that must have been confiscated from the front porch of some fraternity.  In fact I'm not sure they would accept chairs in this condition.  See Photos.  The smoke or fire alarms had evidently been changed as the old one was still hanging on the wall with wires protruding.  See Photo.  There is no way to get any outside air into your room as the windows will not open.  The general smell of the room was not one of cleanliness but a musty damp type of smell.  I don't know who is doing the rating of hotels in Huntington Beach but if this is a 3 star hotel I can't imagine what the one or two stars are like.   Makes you realize

Summary Heading: Excellent Staff, great location for Shopping!
Summary: This hotel is undergoing a much needed facelift.  The new rooms are clean, quiet (apart from the air-conditioning unit) and well appointed.  There is free wireless internet conection in the room!  The staff are eager to help and if anything needs attention it happens quickly (the plug in my tub was blocked - resolved within 30 mins). Great location, right accross the road from the new Huntington Beach mall Bella Terra, movie theater, restaurants etc. I enjoyed my stay here and will be returning on business in future.

Summary Heading: Could use some updating but the price is right!
Summary: We were looking for an inexpensive hotel close to friends in the area.  This is not easy to do in any of the beach towns of Orange County but the Huntington fit the bill.  The room was big and all the appliances worked.  We had the impression that the hotel was a bit shabby but clean.   If you are looking for a beach experience, this is not it but it is close to shopping and dining and the parking lot is large and lighted all night. There were a number of young folk staying there - I think it was for some sporting event.  This would be a good place for a large group because of the price.  It does mean putting up with some noise. One caution - call the hotel for your reservations.  The desk clerk couldn't find our internet reservations even tho' we had the confirmation in our

A big modern looking building near a shopping mall and business center, but rooms were shoddy and not very clean. Many little problems topped off with loss of water without any notice from management, loud slamming self-closing doors, amenities forgotten by housekeeping and poor quality restaurant downstairs.

We booked through Expedia and got a great rate. We did not expect much for the price and some of the reviews that we read in TripAdvisor, but we like adventure and decided to take a chance.  The first room we recieved was horrible it was on the 3rd or 4th floor but they transefered us with out a hitch to a much nicer room on a different floor.   The breakfast was excellent and quite a bargain. From reading the reviews and staying their we would agree that this hotel is in need of an extensive  facelift and quick, its a clean hotel but it doesnt look it. We saw a maid scrubbing the lobby floor for over half an hour and it did not make a difference in apprearance. We probably would not stay here again until they refurbush the hotel.  The service was great especially the bellman!

Stayed 2 nights in a King non-smoking room over Thanksgiving holiday. Only good thing about it was the room had never been smoked in. Had to call the desk for a luggage rack. Next morning had to call the desk for a workable coffee maker (ours was broken in 2 places). The towels were threadbare. The AC wouldn't cool the room. The toilet seat was broken and wobbly. The next morning had to call the desk for shampoo (housekeeping had left all hand lotion...no shampoo) and had to ask for washcloths (the room was for 2 people and only one washcloth had been left by housekeeping). The desk sent up hand towels, and when I called again, the desk didn't know what I meant by washcloths, until I explained "they're the things you use to wash yourself").  After over 50 years of staying in

Please note: this is a REAL review by a REAL tourist from our trip to the USA from 29.8.2005 until 22.9.2005.  This is accommodation # 8 of that trip If you want to follow the trip, the hotel before this was The Luxor, Las Vegas. Ne.  The beach areas in OC are quite expensive and as we didn’t want to spend too much money, we chose the Hotel Huntington Beach. Definitely a huge mistake as it spoiled lots of the vacation fun of the previous weeks. Staff was friendly, parking is free, and breakfast is good to start with some positive things. But that does not make up for the general “trashy” feeling of that house and the miserable rooms. Everything looks really worn-out, and almost all technical devices seem to be in bad need of repair. Maybe this is a strange European habit but I

With a $65 price tag in Huntington Beach, what do you expect?  Location is not scenic, but very convenient and SAFE!!  The rooms are not the greatest, but definitley worth the price, the front desk staff, bar staff, housekeeping, young and inexperienced, but once again, what do you expect for $65.  If you want more, pay more, but for a good, safe budget hotel, Hotel Huntington Beach fits the bill.

I visit OC a few times each year on business and I really wanted to find a smallish hotel that is easy on my expense account, but THIS IS NOT THE PLACE!  I stayed for two nights - with a break in the middle for one night in San Diego.  I saw three rooms - the first room was so disgusting with stains on the carpet and garbage in the trash can and dirty, dirty bathroom, I immediately returned to the desk and got a somewhat cleaner room.  After a night of enduring loud people in the hall and the elevator that does not work properly, I was terrified to return after my stay in San Diego.  Upon my return I was given an even worse room than the first - stains on walls and carpet, a large hole in one of the walls, the air conditioner was broken.  After requesting a different room, I was

I have to start off by saying that I stayed at this hotel about 2 years ago, and I thought it was wonderful!  BUT.... 2 years have not been good to this hotel!! (must have just turned 40!just kidding)  We checked-in in the evening and we were tired, my husband asked for a luggage cart and they could not located one, so send out a very unpleasant man to help us with our luggage.  We got into the room, the first thing you see is a huge orange stain on the rug, then all the other black gross looking stains start to pop!  The bathroom smelled of mildew and the bathtub mat was so old and smelly it was brittle when i tossed it into the corner trying to get it away from my kids!  The breaking point was the tv remote controller was being held together with a BAND-AID!!  YUCKY!YUCKY

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but poor accomidations
Summary: The drive: We drove from Phoenix, Az. and besides getting confused by the freeways, and making a wrong exit we finally found it.  The hotel is literally right off the 405 freeway.  Beach Blvd. (the 39) is definetly a great backup plan to use if you ever get lost. You either take it to the PCH (the beach) or go by several freeways towards Knotts Berry Farm.    The location:  The hotel is surrounded by corporate office buildings and across from a parking garage that is in the process of being built.  The view from our room was the lovely construction being done on the garage.  I didnt complain because it was either that or a view of the freeway.   My boyfriend and I stayed at this resort because of the location to the beach and disneyland.  Disneyland is about a 15 min drive if

This hotel has all the services and amenities you'll find in a Hilton, but their prices are closer to the Choice hotels.   Great rooms, pool, full service restaurant, bar, free parking, right off the freeway, courteous service.

This hotel was great. The parking is free. Our room was clean and quite large. There were no visible stains in our room. It was quite. The hotel is right off the higway so getting there was very easy.  The only bad thing...its not really near anything. Its abuot a 2 minutes drive to Disney, which isn't so bad, but it is behind a new mall that is being built so the area is kind of dea. But it is off Beach Boulevard which is a main street. I would have put the hotel closer to the beach and on Beach boulevard and itwould have been perfect.

Summary Heading: We were quite pleased with the Hotel HB
Summary: Recently stayed 2 nights at the Hotel HB with the surf and sun package, staff and manager very friendly and helpful, and bent over backwards to make us happy and arrange surf lessons. Rooms are very clean, comfortable and quiet. Glad we had a car for the location, but would recommend it to anyone.

I expect more than I should at times...you can read what I wrote about Days Inn in Encenitas.  This place however is one of the best I have stayed in...at least for the money.  Got it for $50 through Hotwire, and felt I got more the buck here than anywhere else I have ever stayed. The staff went way beyond what I would ever expect, some of the kindest and most corteous people anywhere. I would stay here again anytime..at twice what I paid!!

The staff at Hotel HB could not have been nicer.  We stayed there with several other families as our sons were in a wrestling tourny nearby.  The hotel was central to alot of the area attractions that we took advantage of before the tourny started...and we went to the beach...which was amazing.  The room was well appointed and clean, the staff was very helpful (Brittney & Jason)--even the maids were polite...the breakfast buffet was plentiful and delicious, although the OJ seemed to be from concentrate (our only slightly negative comment on the entire experience).  Thanks...we will definately stay again next year!

After reading the reviews, I thought this place would be much better than expected. It was OK, pool was out of order, which was the main reason I booked the hotel. Rooms decent size, but in definate need of a makeover. Not nearly as close to the beach as we would have liked. If you are planning to stay here and enjoy the beach, there are better choices than this hotel.

Summary Heading: Good hotel near Orange County airport
Summary: If you are visiting Orange County for business or pleasure the Hotel Huntington Beach is a cut above the usual.  Clean, modern with all the typical amenities including swimming pool and movies in room.  Only one restaurant on premises.  Free buffet breakfasts with room BUT and this is my chief complaint about this hotel, that breakfast is served only until 9am and is not very good in terms of quality or quantity.  Better breakfast can be obtained by ordering room service but then you have to pay for it.  I did not eat any other meals in that restaurant so I can't comment on the rest of their cooking.
Hotel Huntington Beach was a delight.  The staff was friendly and the room was very large.  I had the most wonderful time during my stay in Huntington Beach.

I appreciated the service that was offered to me when I stayed at your hotel. I discovered my computer was having problems receiving e-mails and the staff there allowed me to use their computer in the business office and download some important documents I needed for work. Ramien Shalizi was even kind enough to give me a blank cd to copy this information to my computer. Thank you very much. I was in a pinch and really appreciate it.

Our family celebrated my Mom's birthday at the hotel's Sunday brunch and it was excellent. There was a wonderful selection of salads, foods and desserts. I can't say enough about the attentive service. Thanks Ramien!

Thank you to Britanney, Lydia and Ramine. These people made our stay in Orange County a pleasure, under difficult circumstances (as we had to attend a funeral). The staff at the Hotel were very pleasant, always had a smile, and seemed to be enjoying helping us. The hotel itself was very good--the brunch was great. Although Sam the bartender talked too much for our liking, and seemed to be a "know-it-all" (and I suppose some people like that in a bartender), the drinks were great. I had forgotten how central Huntington Beach is to everything in Orange County. We are looking forward to returning to OC under happier circumstances, and staying at Hotel Huntington Beach.

We drove down from LAX airport and the hotel was really easy to find, just off the freeway at Beach Blvd. The staff was friendly, the hotel seemed to be quite, but by friday night the place filled up. The bar was full with a lot of fun people. When we first checked in we were put in a room that was on the 3rd floor...the furniture seemd kind of dated, so we asked if there was a better room. They moved us up a couple of floors without a fuss at all--they were actually sweet about our request and we found that the room they moved us to was great.  Nicely furnished, more up to date. Obviously this hotel renovated some, but not all of their rooms recently. We liked the location. We really enjoyed our stay, and would stay there again (but will ask about the room style next time).

I'm not one to complain, but I wish I knew the following before my stay. When we first walked into our room, I thought that someone had made a mistake. It looked nothing like the picture I had been referring to on the websites. If that wasn't enough, this place was old and run down. What was wrong? Let me list: Cigarette stench even though we were on a "non-smoking" floor (even found some cigarette butts by the desk and a lighter on the floor by the bed). Cleanliness...I think they just made the bed before I checked in. The faucet in the bathroom was leaking all over the floor and the bathtub wasn't draining. This one is somewhat funny...there was no iron in the room available. So after calling downstairs for an iron and ironing board, we were first brought an iron and a towel

We enjoyed our stay in HB and found that Hotel Huntington Beach was a pretty good place to make our base for the week.  The food was good and well priced in the restaurant and the kids liked the pool.  It was real easy to find just off the 405, which took some stress off the trip.  Carla was friendly, and the manager even spent some time with us asking about our stay and offering help.  We would go back there.

I was pleased to find that this hotel was so easy to find, right off the Beach Blvd exit...even though it is a couple miles to the beach, it was easy to get on the freeway when we wanted to go to Disney and Knotts.  Although the room decor is not special, it was clean and the staff was very accommodating and friendly.  It was nice to have the restaurant right in the hotel so we did not have to pack the kids up every time we needed to eat.
not good.  I could not get into the hotel where I usually stay.Will not go back.  Old and run down
